loan.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 3 children.
Arlene has a shop in which she sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.
Arlene has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Arlene hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loan.name: Yopi

texts.en:
Yopi is a 32-year-old man and married to Elis, a 28-year-old lady. They actually had two sons, but their first son passed away due to a sickness. Their second son is Rivaldy, 2 years old.
Yopi is working as a livestock salesman. He purchases chickens, pigs, goats, and cattle from the traditional markets in rural places and resells them at the market in the city. He has been involved in the business since 2006.
Yopi dreams of improving his income because of the increasing daily needs, and moreover, he should also take care of his parents.
He plans to buy more livestock such as pigs and goats to be resold, but he does not have capital to do so. He is requesting a loan amounting to IDR 10,000,000. Yopi hopes that TLM will assist him with the loan soon.

loan.use: to purchase more livestock such as pigs and goats to be resold.

loan.name: Resty

texts.en:
Resty has been a member of BRAC Uganda's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) for the past two years. Last year, she took out a loan through the ELA program in the amount of 200,000 Uganda Shillings (UGX). She used the money to buy braids and treatment oil for her salon. With these extra supplies, Resty's business has grown, and Resty was able to fully pay back the 200,000 UGX, with interest. Because of the success of the first loan, Resty is now eligible for a loan of 300,000 UGX from the ELA program. She plans on using this loan to buy more braids and other hair products to continue to expand her business.
Resty would like to thank BRAC, Kiva, and the lenders who contributed towards her efforts to build her business. You can support BRAC Uganda and other entrepreneurs like Resty by contributing to one of our current fundraising loans or by joining the Friends of BRAC Uganda lending team.

loan.use: to pay for materials to make braids.

loan.name: Anacita

texts.en:
Anacita is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 5 children.
Anacita has a food shop or carenderia that sells viands like afritada, carenderia & adobo. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy the raw ingredients needed for making viands.
Anacita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Anacita hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making viands (meats).

loan.name: Yohana

texts.en:
Yohana, is a 49-year-old lady. She is married to Oktovianus, a 53-year-old teacher. From their marriage, they have been blessed with four children, namely; Joniawan, 30 and Juliana, 26, both married; Yudi, 25, and Dewi, 20, both university students.
Yohana is a vegetable seller. She has been running the business for seven years. She used to sell the vegetables at a local market, but after having a grandchild she decided to move the business to her residence so she would be able to look after the business as well as her grandchild. She initiated her business by selling a bundle of vegetable and tomatoes under a tree. After six months she built up a small place and put the stuff in it. She offers various kinds of vegetables and other stuff, e.g.: cabbage, mustard greens, tomatoes, chilies, nuts, firewood, kerosene etc.
Yohana plans to improve her business by adding more stock to sell. She is requesting a loan amounting to IDR 10,000,000 from TLM. She plans to purchase more vegetables, cooking ingredients, firewood, and kerosene to sell. She is hoping that her loan application will be approved by TLM.

loan.use: to purchase more vegetables, cooking ingredients, firewood, and kerosene.

loan.name: Justina Keli

texts.en:
Justina is a married Kenyan lady with two children. She is in the business of a retail shop, which is located within the estate and her customers are the people in the same estate.
Justina sells such items as flour, sugar, eggs and beverages. She says that the business is good, but lately the prices of commodities such as sugar and flour have really skyrocketed, making it hard for her customers to afford. However, she opens the shop from early morning to late evening to ensure that the business is doing well. Her future hope is to open a wholesale shop, to build a house and to educate her children. Justina describes herself as trustworthy and honest.

loan.use: to add stock of flour, sugar, eggs, juice.

loan.name: Allen's Group

texts.en:
Allen's group is comprised of four hardworking women. Allen is 18 years old and lives in the town of Wobulenzi in the Luwero Region of Uganda. For the past two years, Allen has been working hard to manage her clinic, which provides testing and treatment services.
To help expand her business, Allen has requested a loan of 150,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to stock up on medicine, and will help Allen to generate greater profits and pay her school fees. Allen hopes that in the future she will be able to continue her education and become a nurse.
Allen is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Allen's future prospects by helping her to improve her business knowledge.

loan.use: to pay for new medicine

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to buy milk, sugar, luncheon meat, sardines, cocoa, butter, mayonnaise, etc. in bulk to add to her current stock

loan.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is a married man with three children, two of whom attend school, while one is still too young for school. He lives at a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.
For the past three years, he has operated a tuk-tuk (three-wheeled motor vehicle) business, operating between home and the market. The major challenge he faces is competition from other tuk-tuk operators in the area. He dreams of expanding his business in the future.
With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings he wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and beans for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loan.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and beans for resale

loan.name: Tanios

texts.en:
Tanios is a 42-year-old married man, the father of two children. He has worked in entertainment since 2003, when he first opened his network game shop. His business is good, since he is the only one in his region.
Tanios works hard to improve his business as much as he can because this kind of business is highly requested these days. Tanios is a talented, smart man. He moves with technology as much as he can and replies to customers' requests in a very smart way. In order to increase his income, and to increase his customers, Tanios requested a loan from Al Majmoua to buy six new computers, enough to increase his income and make a future plan to expand his workplace possible.
This is Tanios's first experience with Al Majmoua. He hopes it will have a positive effect on his family's social and financial situation.

loan.use: to buy six new computers to increase his business

loan.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children.
Virginia has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 7,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.
Virginia has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Virginia hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to buy gara cloths and Bamakos (locally dyed cloth) to add to her business

loan.name: Olmarie

texts.en:
Olmarie is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children.
Olmarie has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 7,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.
Olmarie has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Olmarie hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loan.name: Bakari

texts.en:
Bakari is a married man with one child who is still young for school. He lives at a rental house that neither has electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.
For the past five months, Bakari has operated a vegetable stall business, selling green vegetables and tomatoes as retail. His potential customers are neighbors and passersby. He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. He dreams of establishing a hardware shop in the future.
With the 15,000 KES loan, he wants to establish a restaurant business, purchase cooking pans, spoons and plates for the business. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loan.use: To purchase cooking pans, spoons and plates for the restaurant business

loan.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine lives in Uganda. She is widowed with 4 children and all go to school. She has no additional family members. She lives in her own house and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her monthly expenses include rent for her business premises, utility bills and school fees.
Christine sells secondhand shoes. She has been in business for the last 5 years. She sells her products from a shop that she rents. She works 7 days a week. She has requested for a loan of 1,500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more bales of secondhand shoes. Christine generates additional income through selling bags. Her major business challenges include transportation, thieves and seasonality.
Her goal of inspiration is to build rental houses and rental rooms, and also to expand her business so that she sells on a wholesale basis.

loan.use: to buy more bales of secondhand shoes

loan.name: Chernor

texts.en: Chernor is a small-scale businessman in the northern city of Makeni. The 38-year-old is a native of Makeni city. He is a husband and father of two children. His wife is a nurse and one of his children is attending primary school. Chernor sells medicines and has been running this business for the past three years. He has requested a loan of 3,000,000 SLL from Kiva field partner SMT, in order to improve his pharmacy. He will use this loan to buy different types of drugs to add to his pharmacy.

loan.use: to buy different types of drugs to add to his pharmacy

loan.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 24-year-old single man. He has 9 years of experience working as a women's hairdresser and started running his own business since that time. With his requested loan from Kiva partner A. Majmoua, Ali will be able to do necessary decorations to his shop, such as changing his shop's tiles, and to buy a tattoo machine in order to reply to customers' requests. Ali will redecorate his salon in order to offer his clients a comfortable and beautiful place.
This is Ali's second cycle with A. Majmoua. His previous loan was very effective. It helped a lot in improving his income. Ali was a good standing borrower.
Ali hopes to stay on top of clients' expectations, and to expand his business more and more through adding more services in the future.

loan.use: To do necessary decorations to his shop, and also to buy a tattoo machine

loan.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a married woman with two children, one attends school while one is still young for school. Josephine lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.
For the past year, she has operated a shoe sales business, selling from door to door and from her home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of delayed payments by creditors. She dreams of establishing a cosmetics shop in the future.
With the 30,000 KES, she wants to purchase bundles of shoes for both men and women for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loan.use: To purchase bundles of shoes for both men and women

loan.name: Joilyn

texts.en:
Joilyn is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children.
Joilyn has a shop that sells soaps, detergents and cleansing agents. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for 7,000 PHP to buy detergents, cleansing agents and soaps.
Joilyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Joilyn hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy detergents, cleansing agent and soaps

loan.name: Jessibel

texts.en:
Jessibel is 42 years old, married, and has two children. She lives in the Philippines. Jessibel has a shop that buys and sells firewood. She has had this business for five years.
Jessibel is requesting a loan for 7,000 PHP, which she will use to buy firewood to sell. Jessibel has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to purchase firewood to sell.

loan.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
Luvuno is a widow and has six children. She has a house with neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for her family.
Luvuno has operated a charcoal selling business for the past three years; her potential clients are local area customers. She faces a major challenge of transportation. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.
Luvuno is requesting a loan for 30,000 KES, which she will use to purchase bundles of charcoal bags. She decided to join Yehu because of fast accessibility to loan facilities.

loan.use: to purchase bundles of charcoal bags.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to buy more mobile phones and phone accessories to add to his business

loan.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 26 years old and has two children. She does tailoring to earn a living. She has been in the business for one year and has employed one person. Even though she runs her business in a very competitive environment, she has retained her customers because of her good reputation.
Joyce hopes to open other outlets of her business in the future. She needs a loan of 10,000 Kenya shillings to buy fabric.

loan.use: to buy fabric

loan.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 10 children, all of whom attend school. She has additional family members. She lives in her own house with access to piped water and electricity. Her monthly expenses are school fees and rent.
Irene has a restaurant, which she has run for the past six years. She operates on retail basis. Her other source of income comes through teaching. She works seven days a week.
Irene is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more sauce pans, plates, bunches of bananas, rice, and maize flour for her restaurant. Her goal is to expand her restaurant into a hotel.

loan.use: to purchase sauce pans, plates, bunches of bananas, rice, and maize flour.

loan.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 3 children.
Imelda has a shop from which she sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.
Imelda has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Imelda hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loan.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is a married man. He has four children, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that has neither electricity, nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.
For the past two years, Mohammed has operated a food stall business, selling from home to his neighbours and passersby. He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. He dreams of purchasing a motorcycle business in the future.
With the KES 20,000 he wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking fat oil. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loan.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking fat oil.

loan.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a married woman who has two school going children. They live at a rental house that has electricity, but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.
For the past seven years, Grace has operated a restaurant business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a challenge of price fluctuation in her business. Grace dreams of establishing an M-pesa(mobile money transfer) business in the future.
With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, rice, maize flour and sugar for the restaurant business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loan.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, rice, maize flour and sugar, for the restaurant business.

loan.name: Mark Jhun

texts.en:
Mark Jhun is 24 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has 5 children.
Mark Jhun provides motorela, or habal-habal, services. He has had this business for 5 years. He has requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy tools & to pay for gasoline and maintenance for his vehicle.
Mark Jhun has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Mark Jhun hopes to improve his business.

loan.use: to buy tools & to pay for the gasoline and maintenance.

loan.name: Sincerity Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the Sincerity group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of 1,000,000 SLL for each. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions.
Isatu is the leader of this group. The 55-year-old is married to a businessman and they have 3 children - 2 in primary school and 1 in secondary school. Isatu has been a businesswoman for 8 years now. She sells used clothes. With her share of this loan, she will buy bales of used clothes to add to her business.

loan.use: to buy bales of used clothes to add to her business

loan.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 30-year-old married woman, mother of one child. Fatima opened her business in 2004. She sells clothes and shoes. She is a hard working woman, who seeks perfection in her social and business life.
Fatima has requested a loan from Al Majmoua, in order to buy new her Autumn/Winter collection at good prices. Fatima has been an Al Majmoua borrower for 9 consecutive cycles and she is a good standing borrower with a perfectly developed career. She started with a very small shop that turned into a special one, as she describes. Her shop is in a crowded area with a high population, which is helpful for increasing her income.
Fatima works hard to improve her family's income by providing quality education and healthy living for her family.

loan.use: to buy new Autumn/Winter collection with good prices.

loan.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has five children.
Betty has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years.
She requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.
Betty has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Betty hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to buy peanuts and clay for resale

loan.name: Kadii

texts.en:
Kadii is a married woman with four children who are all grown. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to provision of the family's basic needs. She has a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.
She has operated a livestock buying and selling business for the past one year. Her potential clients are the local neighbors. She faces a major challenge of transportation. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.
With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase more goats for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access business loans.

loan.use: To purchase more goats for her business.

loan.name: Erick

texts.en:
Erick is 21 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has one child.
Erick has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. He has had this business for three years. He requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.
Erick has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Erick hopes to improve his business.

loan.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loan.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard is a married man with two school-going children. He lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.
For the past five years, he has operated a retail shop business, selling households items like maize flour, wheat flour, sugar and washing detergents. He faces a major challenge of theft because of insecurity in his area of operation. He dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.
With the KES 20,000 he wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, sugar, salt and cooking oil. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loan.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, sugar, salt and cooking oil.

loan.name: Irenea

texts.en:
Irenea is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children.
Irenea has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years.
She requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages. Irenea has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loan.name: Abou

texts.fr: Monsieur Abou est un jeune mcanicien de 33 ans qui volue dans ce secteur dactivit depuis plus de 20 ans. Cest une activit quil a choisi par amour et par passion depuis son tendre enfance, ce qui lui a valu mme dabandonner ses tudes pour s adonner la mcanique. Il est membre dun des guichets de lU-IMCEC depuis juillet 2004. Il sollicite un crdit de 200 000 frs prvu pour lachat dun moteur destin a rfectionner son vhicule qui est tomb en panne.
texts.en: Mr Abou, aged 33, is a young mechanic who has been working in this activity for over 20 years. He chose it because of the passion and love that he has felt for it since his early childhood. He even dropped out of school to become a mechanic. Abou has been a member of one of the branches of the microfinance institution U-IMCEC since July 2004. He applies for a loan of 200,000 CFA francs to buy an engine for a car that broke down.

loan.use: to buy an engine for a car that broke down.

loan.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has six children and two go to school. She has two additional family members (a cousin and a brother). She lives in her own house and her family has access to piped water and electricity. Her biggest monthly expenses are school fees and food.
She sells local gin (waragi). She has been in business for the last three years. She sells her products on a retail basis from home. She works seven days a week.
Her other source of income is rental houses.
She has requested for a loan of 1,200,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more jerrycans of local gin for her business.
Her major business challenge is transportation. Her goal is to renovate her rental houses so that she can earn more money from them.

loan.use: To buy more jerrycans of local gin.

loan.name: Katerina

texts.en: Katerina is from Uzhgorod. She sells men's and women's clothing at one of the local markets. Katerina has one retail outlet, her merchandise is always is demand, and she has her own customer base. Katerina has been involved in business for about 12 years. Her net profit exceeds 3 500 hryvnia. Katerina plans to invest 10 000 hryvnia into the purchase of an additional inventory of clothing for sale at her store. She is an entrepreneurial and hard-working person. She is full of strength and energy and ready to work diligently to further develop her business and improve her living conditions.

loan.use: to buy an additional inventory of clothing for sale at her store

loan.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 24 years old and single. She runs a bookstore to earn a living. She has been in the business for three years. She was previously employed. Through Faulu Kenya, she has been trained on business management skills and this has helped her to improve her business.
Susan hopes to be a successful business-lady in the future. She has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy books and text books.

loan.use: to buy books and text books

loan.name: Meyminatou

texts.fr: Madame Meyminatou vit au Sngal. Elle est ge de 45 ans. Elle volue depuis 5 ans dans le commerce et la vente de petit djeuner, wax et thioups. Elle pratique aussi la couture et le tricotage quelle a appris en intgrant un centre de formation en couture et en tricotage. Ce qui lintresse surtout dans son activit cest lesprit de cration, la beaut et les retombes financires qui en dcoulent. Elle est membre de lun des guichets de lU-IMCEC depuis avril 2011. Elle sollicite un crdit de 200 000 frs prvu pour lachat dhabits et de portables revendre. Son vu est de voyager pour la Mauritanie pour se les procurer. Elle souhaite encore diversifier les produits quelle commercialise pour mieux dvelopper son activit de commerce.
texts.en: Mrs Meyminatou is 45 years old and lives in Senegal. For the past five years she has been selling breakfasts as well as wax and thioup fabrics. In addition, she sews and knits. She learnt these skills in a training center for sewing and knitting. She particularly likes the creativity, the beauty and the financial spin-offs of her activity. She has been a member of one of the branches of the microfinance institution U-IMCEC since April 2011. She applies for a loan of 200,000 CFA francs to buy clothes and mobile phones for resale. She wants to travel to Mauritania to get them. She intends to further diversify her inventory in order to better develop her business activity.

loan.use: to buy clothes and mobile phones for resale.

loan.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has two children.
Ana has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years.
She requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.
Ana has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Ana hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loan.name: Daudi

texts.en:
Daudi is a married man who lives at a rental house that has piped water but not electricity. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.
For the past five years, he has operated a retail shop business, selling to his neighbors and passersby. He faces a major challenge of delayed payments by creditors in his business. Daudi dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.
With the KES 20,000 he wants to purchase bundles of sugar, maize flour, detergents and cooking oil. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loan.use: To purchase bundles of sugar, maize flour, detergents and cooking oil.

loan.name: Yevgen

texts.en: Evgen is from Drogobych, Western Ukraine. He has a wife and two children. Yevgen sells at the Malyi market and has a small dishware store. He always has reasonable prices that are close to wholesale prices. Yevgen started this retail business 11 years ago. Currently, his gross income is 13 500 hryvnia. Yevgen needs a loan in the sum of 10 000 hryvnia in order to buy an additional inventory of merchandise for sale, specifically, pots, skillets, dishware sets, buckets, etc. He wants to buy the merchandise in anticipation of the seasonal increase in prices. His friendly disposition to customers and business neighbors, work experience, responsibility and business stability characterize Yevgen even in the time of crisis as a promising and goal-oriented entrepreneur, who is ready to further invest in his business and provide for himself and his family.

loan.use: to buy an additional inventory of merchandise for sale, specifically, pots, skillets, dishware sets, buckets, etc.

loan.name: Tirisa

texts.en:
Tirisa is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has five children.
Tirisa has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for two years.
She requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.
Tirisa has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Tirisa hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loan.name: Mamadou

texts.fr: Monsieur Mamadou vit au Sngal. Il est gardien depuis 5 ans. Il est socitaire dans lun des guichets de lU-IMCEC. Il avait dj entam une construction qui est inacheve. Il sollicite un crdit de 200 000 frs prvu pour lachvement. Ce financement lui permettra damliorer son cadre de vie.
texts.en: Mr Mamadou lives in Senegal. He has been a security guard for the past five years. He is a member of one of the branches of the microfinance institution U-IMCEC. He began the construction of a house which is still unfinished. He applies for a loan of 200,000 CFA francs to complete the construction. This loan will enable him to improve his living conditions.

loan.use: to finish the construction of his home.

loan.name: Svetlana

texts.en: Svetlana is married and has an adult son, Vyacheslav. She provides hair-styling services at the "Dashenka" beauty salon. She has been working in this business for about 30 years. Svetlana has a revolving capital of about 5 000 hryvnia, and her net profit is 3 000 hryvnia per month. She plans to use the loan in the sum of 8 000 hryvnia to purchase new equipment and materials, expand service offerings and customer base and, thus, make additional profits. Svetlana plans to use the resulting profit to make repairs to her apartment, improve her family's welfare and further develop her business.

loan.use: to purchase new equipment and materials, expand service offerings and customer base

loan.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is a married woman with two children, both of whom are still too young for school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.
For the past two years, she has operated a fish-selling business, selling in a shop and from home to her neighbors. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of establishing a wholesale fish shop in the future.
With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase fish for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loan.use: To purchase fish for resale.

loan.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl is 21 years old, married, and has two children. She lives in the Philippines. Cheryl has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for two years.
Cheryl is requesting a loan for 7,000 PHP, which she will use to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages. Cheryl has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Cheryl hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to purchase canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loan.name: Maimouna

texts.fr: Madame Maimouna habite au Sngal dans lune de ses communauts. Elle sactive depuis plus de 10 ans dans le commerce et la vente de charbon de bois, et divers autres produits saisonniers comme la mangue, les cacahutes et le pain de singe. Elle a choisi son activit par opportunit. Elle est membre de lun des guichets de lU-IMCEC depuis novembre 2009. Elle sollicite un crdit de 150 000 frs prvu pour lachat de charbon de bois a revendre. Son objectif est daccroitre son activit de commerce de charbon de bois pour mieux amliorer ses revenus.
texts.en:
Madame Maimouna lives in a community in Sngal. She has been working selling charcoal for more than 10 years. She also sells various seasonal commodities such as mangoes, peanuts, and monkey bread (baobab fruit). She just happened upon this business opportunity. She has been a member of one of the branches of U-IMCEC since November 2009.
She is requesting a loan of 150,000 francs to use to buy more charcoal for resale. Her goal is to grow her charcoal sales business so that she can earn more income.

loan.use: to buy charcoal for resale.

loan.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is a business woman aged 37. She is married and blessed with two children who are still in school. For the last one year she has been managing a grocery business to earn a living. In the next 5 years, she wants to buy a plot of land.
She is requesting a loan of 10,000 Kenyan shillings to buy vegetables and fruits.

loan.use: to buy vegetables and fruits

loan.name: Esha

texts.en:
Esha is married and has one child. She lives at a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.
For the past two years, Esha has operated a restaurant, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition from restaurant operators in the area. Esha dreams of expanding her business in the future.
Esha is requesting a loan for 20,000 KES, which she will use to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and beans. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loan.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and beans.

loan.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 28 years old, married, and has two children. She lives in the Philippines. Maricel has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for three years.
Maricel is requesting a loan for 7,000 PHP, which she will use to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages .Maricel has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Maricel hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loan.name: Hendriether

texts.en:
Hendriether is a divorced woman with six children; four attend school, and two have already graduated from school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.
With the 20,000 Kenya shillings (KES) loan she is requesting she wants to start a vegetable stall business, and to purchase sacks of onions, cabbages, tomatoes, and oranges. She dreams of expanding her business to meet the demand of her customers in the future.

loan.use: To purchase sacks of onions, cabbages, tomatoes, and oranges.

loan.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with five children; three attend school, and two are adults. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.
For the past four years, she has operated a restaurant business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition from other restaurant operators in the area. She dreams of expanding her business to make more profits in the future.
With the 20,000 Kenya shillings (KES) loan, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, cooking fat oil, and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loan.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, cooking fat oil, and sugar.

loan.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children.
Patricia has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 7,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell.
Patricia has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Patricia hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loan.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is a hardworking business woman aged 25. She is married and blessed with two children. For the last two years, she has been managing a salon to earn a living. In the next 5 years, she wants to expand her business.
She is requesting a loan of 10,000 Kenyan shillings to buy hair chemicals and braids.

loan.use: to buy hair chemicals and braids

loan.name: Yaye Diakhou

texts.fr: Madame Yaye est une veuve de 54 ans. Elle vit au Sngal. Elle volue dans le secteur du commerce depuis plus de 25 ans. Elle pratique la vente de petit djeuner, de pommes de terre et doignons dans le quartier ou elle habite. La raison qui la pouss choisir cette activit est la recherche de revenus qui lui permettent de subvenir ses besoins personnels mais aussi a ceux de ses petits-enfants. Cest un parent bnficiaire qui a dj bnfici de 21 prts antrieurs au sein de lun des guichets de lU-IMCEC ou elle est membre depuis juillet 2000. Elle sollicite un crdit de 150 000 prvus pour lachat des produits quelle commercialise. Elle veut renforcer son fond de roulement et lutter contre les fluctuations des prix des produits dues a lhivernage.
texts.en:
Mrs. Yaye, age 54, is a widow and lives in Senegal. She's been in the trade business for more than 25 years. She sells breakfasts, potatoes and onions in the neighborhood where she lives. She chose this business in order to earn an income to support herself and her grandchildren.
She's a parent who already benefited from 21 loans from Kiva's partner, U-IMCEC, of which she's been a member since July 2000.
She's seeking a loan of XOF 100'000 in order to buy products for resale. She wants to bolster her working capital and fight against price fluctuations during the rainy season.

loan.use: to buy products for resale (breakfasts, potatoes and onions)

loan.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a married woman with one child who attends school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.
For the past two years, she has operated a business selling khangas (brightly colored patterned cloth, commonly worn as a wrap or scarf), selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition from other Khanga sellers in the area. She dreams of establishing a retail shop in the future.
With the 20,000 Kenya shillings (KES) loan, she wants to purchase bundles of kangas for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loan.use: To purchase bundles of khangas for resale.

loan.name: Ma. Estela

texts.en:
Ma. Estela is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children.
Ma. Estela has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 7,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy more canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell.
Ma. Estela has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Ma. Estela hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell.

loan.name: Samvel

texts.en: Samvel is 33 years old. He lives in the town of Ijevan. After completing military service, he got married and now has two children - a boy and a girl, both of whom attend a secondary school. Samvel's wife is a homemaker. Samvel has been leasing a shop since 1999, where he has been involved in processing wood. He buys wood from the Ijevan forestry and uses it to make parquet flooring, box details, floor plinths and also fills private orders. Samvel sells his products in Ijevan, Yerevan and also sells them to his loyal customers from Hoktemberyan and Echmiadzin districts. Thanks to this business, Samvel is able to provide for his family. He needs a loan in the sum of 900 000 dram to buy an inventory of wood and a woodworking machine. This is Samvel's fourth loan from the Nor Horizon organization, and he has never been late on loan repayments.

loan.use: to buy wood and woodworking machine for his business

loan.name: Dushirukumwete Group

texts.fr:
Jacqueline est une commerante ge de 38ans qui habite la localit de Gihamagara de la Province de Gitega au centre du pays. Elle fait le commerce de vin de bananes depuis 24ans. Elle faisait le commerce de farine et de Primus avant de commencer cette activit. Elle a frquent lcole jusquen 6e anne primaire. Elle est marie a Elias et ont ensemble 5 enfants dont 2 tudient a lcole primaire. Le crdit Kiva de 100,000 francs burundais quelle obtient lui permet daugmenter son capital pour acheter une grande quantit de vin de bananes revendre afin de raliser de grands bnfices.
Elle est membre du groupe communautaire DUSHIRUKUMWETE.
texts.en:
Jacqueline is a 38-year-old merchant living in Gihamagara, a village in the province of Gitega in central Burundi. She has been selling banana wine for 24 years, after having sold flour and Primus beer for some time. She attended elementary school until sixth grade. She is married to Elias. Together they have five children, with two of them attending elementary school.
Jacqueline will use her loan share of 100,000 Burundi francs provided through Kiva to increase her working capital and buy a large quantity of banana wine for resale. She expects to make a good profit.
Jacqueline is a member of Dushirukumwete Community Group.

loan.use: to expand her working capital and buy a large quantity of banana wine in order to earn a good profit.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to buy a grinding machine

loan.name: Grezza

texts.en:
Grezza is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child.
Grezza has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 7,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell.
Grezza has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Grezza hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell.

loan.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with five children, two of whom go to school. She has one additional family member. She sells fresh milk in a shop on a retail basis. She works seven days a week. She has been in this business for the last 10 years.
Alex has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Uganda shillings (UGX) from MCDT SACCO to buy a refrigerator and jerry cans (a type of container for liquid) for milk. Her major challenge is seasonality. Her inspiration goal is to to see her business grow big so that she can buy milk cans instead of using jerry cans for milk. She lives in a rented house and her family has access to electricity, but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loan.use: To buy a refrigerator and jerry cans to improve her business.

loan.name: Ummoja

texts.en:
Ummoja is a single woman who lives at a family house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the extended family.
For the past three years, she has operated a restaurant business, operating from the market, whereby town dwellers and neighbours are her potential customers. She faces a major challenge of competition. Her major dream is to expand her restaurant business in the future.
With the 20,000 Kenya shillings (KES) loan, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, beans, rice, and maize flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loan.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, beans, rice, and maize flour.

loan.name: Ubumenyi Group

texts.fr:
Graciose est une commerante ge de 33ans qui habite la localit de Rutegama de la Province de Muramvya au centre du pays. Elle fait le commerce de la bire locale de bananes et du sorgho depuis 15ans. Elle est aussi cultivatrice. Elle a frquent lcole jusquen 6e anne primaire. Elle est marie a Celison et ont ensemble 3 enfants dont 2 qui tudient a lcole primaire. Le crdit Kiva de 140,000 francs burundais quelle obtient lui permet daugmenter son capital pour acheter une grande quantit de bire locale de bananes et du sorgho revendre afin de raliser de grands bnfices.
Elle est membre du groupe communautaire UBUMENYI
texts.en:
Graciose is a 33-year-old merchant living in Rutegama, a village in the province of Muramvya in central Burundi. She has been selling for 15 years local beer made from bananas and sorghum. She is also a farmer. She attended elementary school until sixth grade. She is married to Celison. Together they have three children, with two of them attending elementary school.
Graciose will use her loan share of 140,000 Burundi francs provided through Kiva to increase her working capital and buy a large quantity of local banana and sorghum beer for resale. She expects to make a good profit.
Graciose is a member of Ubumenyi Community Group.

loan.use: to increase her working capital and buy a large quantity of local banana and sorghum beer for resale in order to make a good profit.

loan.name: Lucia

texts.en: Lucia, a hardworking 42-year-old businesswoman who is married and blessed with four children, has been selling cereals for the last year to earn a living. She is also employed as a teacher. Lucia, who has grown her business with her previous loan from Faulu Kenya, is now requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy beans and peas. In the next five years, she wants to expand her enterprise.

loan.use: to buy beans and peas.

loan.name: Zayola

texts.en:
Zayola is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child.
Zayola provides transportation services by motorela (an enclosed motorcycle carriage) or habal-habal (a motorcycle with an extended seat that can carry multiple passengers). She has had this business for five years.
Zayola requested a loan of 7,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy tools and to pay for gasoline and maintenance. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Zayola hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy tools and pay for gasoline and maintenance.

loan.name: Tubemaso Group

texts.fr:
Ferdinand est un commerant g de 46ans qui habite la localit de Bukirasazi de la Province de Gitega au centre du pays. Il vend des produits vivriers comme le caf, le haricot, les pommes de terre et les bananes depuis 28ans. Il est aussi cultivateur. Il na pas frquent lcole. Il est mari et pre de enfants dont 5qui tudient. Le crdit Kiva de 130,000 francs burundais quil obtient lui permet daugmenter son capital pour acheter une grande quantit de produits vivriers comme le caf, le haricot, les pommes de terre et les bananes revendre afin de raliser de grands bnfices.
Il est membre du groupe communautaire TUBEMASO.
texts.en:
Ferdinand is a 46-year-old storekeeper who lives in the town of Bukirasazi, within the province of Gitega in the center of the country. He has sold food staples like coffee, beans, potatoes and bananas for 28 years. He is also a farmer. He did not go to school. He is married and a father; five of his children go to school.
The Kiva loan of 130,000 B. francs that Ferdinand is seeking will allow him to increase his capital in order to buy a large quantity of food staples, such as coffee, beans, potatoes and bananas so that he can resell them in order turn a large profit.
Ferdinand is a member of the Tubemaso community group.

loan.use: to increase their capital and buy a large quantity of food staples - such as coffee, beans, potatoes and bananas - to resell in order to make a large profit.

loan.name: Divina Gracia

texts.en:
Divina Gracia is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. She has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 5 years.
Divina Gracia requested a loan for 7,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell.

loan.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is a businesswoman aged 34. She is married and blessed with three children. For the last nine years, she has been selling fish to earn a living. She also sell clothes for more income generation. She has been able to improve her business since she joined Faulu Kenya. In the next five years, she wants to expand her business.

loan.use: To buy fish.

loan.name: Twubahe Group

texts.fr:
Marie est une commerante ge de 26ans qui habite la localit de Bukirasazi de la Province de Gitega au centre du pays. Elle fait le commerce de dtail dans sa boutique pour divers articles comme le savon, lhuile de palme, les biscuits, le sucre, le haricot, le riz, etc depuis 15ans. Elle est aussi cultivatrice. Elle na pas frquent lcole. Elle est marie et mre de 3 enfants dont 1qui tudie a lcole primaire. Le crdit Kiva de 570,000 francs burundais quelle obtient lui permet daugmenter son capital pour acheter une grande quantit darticles divers de boutique comme le savon, lhuile de palme, les biscuits, le sucre, le haricot, le riz, etc revendre afin de raliser de grands bnfices.
Elle est membre du groupe solidaire TWUBAHE.
texts.en:
Marie is a 26-year-old trader who lives in the town of Bukirasazi, in Gitega province, in the center of Burundi. She is married with 3 children, one of whom goes to primary school. She herself has no formal education. She has been running her own store for 15 years and sells various products including soap, palm oil, biscuits, sugar, beans and rice. She also farms.
Marie will use the loan of 570 000 Burundese francs to restock her store with products to sell for a good profit. She is a member of the Twubahe solidarity group.

loan.use: to restock on products such as soap, palm oil, biscuits, sugar, beans, rice, etc.

loan.name: Bintijuma

texts.en:
Bintijuma is a single woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives in a family house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.
For the last four years, she has operated a beauty salon business, her potential customers being neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Bintijuma dreams of expanding her business in the future.
With this 10,000 Kenya shillings (KES) loan, she plans to purchase cosmetics for her beauty salon business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loan.use: To purchase cosmetics for her beauty salon business.

loan.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with six children, all of whom go to school. She sells charcoal from home on a retail basis. She has been in business for 16 years and works six days a week. She also has a motorcycle as her other source of income.
Florence has requested a loan of 900,000 Uganda shillings (UGX) from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal to sell. Her major challenges include transportation. Her inspiration goal is to build rental houses. She lives in her own house and her family has access to piped water and electricity. Her monthly expense includes school fees.

loan.use: To buy more bags of charcoal to sell.

loan.name: Delcy

texts.en:
Delcy is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children.
Delcy has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 7,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.
Delcy has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Delcy hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell.

loan.name: Twubakerugume Group

texts.fr:
Rosette est une commerante ge de 34ans qui habite la localit de Bukirasazi de la Province de Gitega au centre du pays. Elle fait le commerce de caf et des bananes depuis 19ans. Elle tait lve avant de commencer cette activit. Elle a fait ses tudes jusquen 6e anne primaire. Elle est marie et mre de 5 enfants dont 3qui tudient. Le crdit Kiva de 100,000 francs burundais quelle obtient lui permet daugmenter son capital pour acheter une grande quantit de caf et des bananes revendre afin de raliser de grands bnfices.
Elle est membre du groupe communautaire TWUBAKERUGUME.
texts.en:
Rosette is a 34-year-old merchant who lives in the district of Bukirasazi, in the province of Gitega, which is at the center of the country. She is a member of the community group TWUBAKERUGUME.
She started trading in coffee and bananas 19 years ago. Prior to embarking on this activity, she was a student and remained in school up to the 6th grade. She is married with five children, three of whom attend school.
The loan of 100,000 Burundian francs will allow her to increase her working capital. She will buy large quantities of coffee and bananas, which she will sell to earn substantial profits.

loan.use: to increase her working capital and buy large quantities of coffee and bananas for resale

loan.name: Jenalyn

texts.en: Jenalyn, a 21-year-old single woman who lives in the Philippines, has had a shop that sells green and yellow bananas for the past two years. A member of HSPFI since 2011, she has requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages. In the future, Jenalyn hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loan.name: Haliyangu

texts.en:
Haliyangu, a married woman with one child who attends school, lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past year, she has operated a retail shop business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces the major challenge of competition from other retail shop operators and dreams of establishing another business in the future.

Having decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business, with a loan of Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, washing soaps and rice.

loan.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, washing soaps and rice.

loan.name: Gonzalo

texts.es:
El seor Gonzalo es origen de la comunidad de Kolque Koya Alto de la Provincia de Tiraque del Departamento de Cochabamba actualmente casado con 7 hijos a cargo de ellos
Prcticamente la actividad econmica a la que se dedica el seor Gonzalo es la agricultura, la produccin de tubrculos y cereales en su comunidad de Kolque Koya, que est ubicado a cinco kilmetros al este aproximadamente de la localidad de Tiraque.
El crdito que solicita es para la compra de insumos agrcolas, semillas, abono e insecticidas, el objetivo del cliente es incrementar su produccin agrcola al ao siguiente, y as de mejorar las condiciones de vida en su familia
texts.en:
Gonzalo is from the Kolque Koya Alto community in the province of Tiraque, department of Cochabamba. He is married and raising seven children. His main source of income is agriculture, and he farms tubers and grains in his community of Kolque Koya, located about five kilometers to the east of Tiraque.

He will use the loan to buy agricultural fertilizer, seeds, and insecticide. His goal is to increase his crop production for the following year and improve the quality of life of his family.

loan.use: buy agricultural fertilizer

loan.name: Martha Carina

texts.es:
Carina tiene 33 aos de edad, es una persona trabajadora. Ella vive en la zona de Esquilan Chico de la provincia de Quillacollo, genera sus ingresos de la venta de leche que obtiene de sus vacas, ordea sus vacas 2 veces al dia de forma manual a las 5 de la maana y a las 7 de la noche. Carina vive con su familia, necesita el prstamo para acceder junto a 15 compaeros de su zona, a la compra de un tanque de enfriamiento para la leche y de esta manera puedan conservar mayor tiempo el producto y no entren en perdida lo que afectara gravemente a la economa de sus familias debido a que dependen casi exclusivamente de la venta de leche cruda de buena calidad. Ella est muy agradecida con la gente que por medio de Kiva le pudo dar la oportunidad de hacer realidad su sueo.
Carina entre sus planes futuros planea sacar un nuevo prstamo para comprar ms vaquitas.
Para compra conjunta, de un tanque de enfriamiento para acopio de leche, que tiene un costo de $16000 al cual estan aportando 16 vecinos con 1000
texts.en:
Carina, 33, is a hard-working person. She lives in the Esquilan Chico area in the province of Quillacollo. She generates her income by selling milk that she obtains from her cows. She milks her cows manually twice a day, at 5 in the morning and 7 in the evening.
Carina lives with her family. She needs the loan to buy a refrigeration tank for the milk along with 15 friends from her area. In this way they will be able to keep the product longer and not suffer any losses, which would seriously affect the economy of their families, since they depend almost exclusively on the sale of good-quality raw milk.
She is very grateful to the people who managed through Kiva to give her the chance to make her dream come true.
Among her plans for the future Carina plans to take out a new loan to buy more cows.
The joint purchase of a refrigeration tank for storing milk has a cost of $16,000, to which each of the 16 neighbors is contributing $1,000.

loan.use: to pay for the joint purchase of a refrigeration tank for storing milk.

loan.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is a married woman who owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past four years, she has operated a dressmaking shop business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business, and dreams of establishing a clothes-selling business in the future.

Having decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business, Mwanaisha wants to purchase cloth materials for resale with a loan of Kshs 20,000.

loan.use: to purchase cloth materials for resale.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to purchase bundles of clothes for resale.

loan.name: Aidah

texts.en:
Aidah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with 4 children, 3 of whom go to school. She lives in a rental house, and her family has access to piped water and electricity. She explains that her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

She sells charcoal on a retail basis at the market. She has been in this business for the last 6 years. She works 7 days per week.

She has requested a loan in the amount of 800,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. Her major business challenge is transportation and seasonality. Her goal is to build rental houses in the future.

loan.use: To purchase additional bags of charcoal

loan.name: Cathy Jean

texts.en:
Cathy Jean is 24 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child.

Cathy Jean has a food shop (or carenderia) where she makes and sells foods like stews (e.g., afritada and kaldereta). She has been running this business for 2 years.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of 7,000 PHP to buy more raw ingredients for her food production operation. Cathy Jean became a member of HSPFI this year. In the future, Cathy Jean hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: To purchase additional raw ingredients for her food production business

loan.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 7 children.

Marites has a shop where she sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has operated this business for 5 years.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of 7,000 PHP to buy more inventory (including canned goods, snacks, and beverages). Marites has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Marites hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: To purchase additional inventory like canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loan.name: Leonarda Migdalia

texts.es: Leonarda Migdalia tiene 41 aos, ella se encuentra muy contenta con su medio de vida, pues le ha ayudado mucho para sacar a su familia adelante uno de sus mayores desafos es que no puede comprar todos los productos que sus clientes le solicitan pues debido a que los precios de las utilidades varan. Es por eso que solicita este crdito con el fin de comprar variedad en sus productos como es perfumes, cremas, ropa en general, sabanas, manteles, prendas entre otros productos.
texts.en:
Leonarda Migdalia is 41 years old. She is very happy with her business, as it has helped her to provide for her family's future.
One of her biggest challenges is that she is unable to buy all the products requested by her customers because the prices vary.
That's why she is requesting this loan to buy an assortment of products, such as perfumes, creams, sheets, tablecloths and clothing.

loan.use: to buy an assortment of products, such as perfumes, creams, sheets, tablecloths and clothing.

loan.name: Mebakari

texts.en:
Mebakari is a married woman with one child who attends school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.
For the past four years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition from other clothes sellers in the area. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing a clothes shop in the future.
With the Kshs15,000, she wants to purchase bundles of Khangas for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loan.use: To purchase bundles of Khangas for resale.

loan.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 4 children who all go to school. She is a tailor. She operates her business on a retail basis in a rented shop. She has been in business for the last 6 years. Annet works six days a week.
She has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy a Baby Lock sewing machine and rolls of clothing material. Her major challenge is seasonality and defaulters. Her goal is to expand into a fashion and design shop. She lives in her own house, and her family has access to piped water and electricity. Her monthly expenses include school fees.

loan.use: To buy a Baby Lock sewing machine and rolls of clothing materials

loan.name: Joann

texts.en:
Joann is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 3 children. Joann has a shop that sells vegetables & spices. She has had this business for 5 years.
She requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy vegetables & spices to sell. Joann has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Joann hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy vegetables & spices to sell

loan.name: Spider Group

texts.en:
Roda, who is in her early 30's, is married and has two school aged children. She has been a tailor, selling bed sheets and fabrics, since 2009. She works from 8 a.m to 8 p.m daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.
This will be her 5th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy a roll of cotton material for bedsheets and dress making, opened a shop for the tailoring business, paid school fees, and paid for the shop rent. She has paid back all her loans successfully. She wants a loan to buy 6 rolls of cotton materials and sewing items. (Normally a good cotton roll contains about 120 meters.) Her dream is to one day be able to buy a motor cycle and give it to her husband who will use it for the transport business.
She will share this loan with her loan group "Spider", which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loan.use: To buy 6 rolls of cotton material and sewing items.

loan.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 3 children. Vivian has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages . She has had this business for 2 years.
She requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages. Vivian has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Vivian hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loan.name: Anifa

texts.en:
Anifa is a married woman with six children. Four of her children attend school, while the other two have already graduated from school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a vegetable stall business, where she sells vegetables to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition and price fluctuation in the market. Anifa dreams of expanding and establishing another business in the future.

With the loan in the amount of 15,000 KES she is requesting, she wants to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, and onions for re-sale purposes. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loan.use: To purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, onions and potatoes for resale.

loan.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam is married and has five children, four of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped-in water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. For the past three years, she has made a living by selling food to neighbors and passersby. Her biggest challenge is competition from other retail operators, but she dreams of expanding her business into a wholesale operation in the future. To make this possible, she is applying for a loan for Kshs 10,000 to buy bundles of maize flour, sugar and beans to sell to her customers. She decided to join Yehu to access loans that will allow her to boost her business.

loan.use: to buy bundles of maize flour, sugar and beans to sell to her customers.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to buy more items to sell to her customers.

loan.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice owns two clothes shops. She opened the current one in October, 2010. She is married and has three children: one in class 3, her first adopted child has completed class 8, and the last born aged 3 years has not began schooling. They live in the Malindi area of Coast Province. Her business is in the heart of a small town and she has a number of customers. Among the coastal people who like nice dresses, she does good business.
Alice was invited to join Milango Financial Services by her friends in May, 2011. A loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings will help Alice buy new stock of clothes, shoes and sufurias (cooking pots). She hopes to improve her business, obtain a larger loan, and build her own business premises, because she rents the current premises. Just like in other tourist destination towns, her business faces a low season in February when there are few sales, but she advises fellow ladies to join Milango in order to obtain credit to improve their businesses.

loan.use: to buy clothes, shoes and cooking utensils

loan.name: Fahamu Group

texts.fr: La cliente Nankafu, leader du groupe daffaire Fahamu, est entrepreneur, ge de 56 ans, marie, mre de plusieurs enfants et petits fils et filles. Son mari est un petit commerant. Elle est vendeuse de vtements (friperie). Elle exerce ces petites activits gnratrices de revenus de ce genre depuis sa jeunesse. Cependant, elle vient de raliser 9 cycles avec crdit de Hekima. Son premier capital fut reu de son mari. Ce nouveau crdit doit lui servir de sapprovisionner avec 5 ballons de friperies et raliser dautres micro projets de la famille. En plus, elle souhaite voir ses enfants grandir confortablement et acheter une jeep pour son dplacement personnel. La cliente remercie Hekima pour ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique.
texts.en:
Nankafu, the borrower and leader of the Fahamu business group, is a 56-year-old businesswoman who is married, the mother of several children, and has grandsons and granddaughters. Her husband is a small storekeeper. She sells clothing (second-hand). She has been undertaking small, income-generating occupations such as this since her youth.
Nankafu has just completed 9 loan cycles with Hekima. Her initial capital came from her husband. This new loan will allow her to provision her business with 5 bales of second-hand clothing and take on other mini-projects for her family. Furthermore, she wishes to see her children grow up comfortably, and to buy a jeep for personal transportation.
Nankafu thanks Hekima for its actions in favor of poor women who are excluded from traditional banks.

loan.use: to purchase 5 bales of second-hand clothing.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to buy coconuts to sell to her customers.

loan.name: Halima

texts.en: Halima is married, has four children and owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped-in water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. For the last four years, she has earned a living by providing tailoring and dressmaking services to neighbors and passersby. Her biggest challenge is the seasonality of her business, but she dreams of establishing a dressmaking school in the future. She is applying for a loan for KSHS 10,000 to buy more of the cloth and materials she needs to make items to sell. She decided to join Yehu to a way to boost her business.

loan.use: to buy materials needed to provide tailoring services.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for their motorcycle.

loan.name: Cirilo

texts.es: El seor Cirilo es origen de la comunidad de Thoqo Rancho Alto de la Provincia de Tiraque del Departamento de Cochabamba actualmente casado con 6 hijos a cargo de ellos. Prcticamente la actividad econmica a que se dedica del seor Cirilo es la agricultura, la produccin de tubrculos y cereales en su comunidad de Thoqo Rancho Alto, que est ubicado de a seis kilmetros al norte aproximadamente de la localidad de Tiraque. El crdito que solicita es para la compra de insumos agrcolas, como abono organico y semillas, el objetivo del cliente es incrementar su produccin agrcola al ao siguiente, y as de mejorar las condiciones de vida en su familia.
texts.en:
Cirilo is from the community of Thoqo Rancho Alto in the province of Tiraque in the department of Cochabamba. Currently he is married and they are responsible for six children.
Practically, the economic activity he's involved in is agriculture, the production of tubers and cereals in his community of Thoqo Rancho Alto, which is located approximately six kilometers north of Tiraque.
The loan he is requesting is to buy agricultural supplies, such as organic fertilizer and seeds. His objective is to increase his crops next year, and so improve his family's living conditions.

loan.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loan.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children and three of them go to school. She has additional family members. She sells second-hand clothes at the market. She operates her business on a retail basis. She works six days a week. Her other source of income is from rental houses .She has been in business for the last six years.
Ruth has requested a loan of 500,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy second-hand clothes. Her major business challenge is seasonality and transportation. Her inspiration goal is to build rental houses and also educate her children to university. Ruth lives in her own house and her family has access to piped water and electricity. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and rent.

loan.use: To buy more bales of used clothes.

loan.name: Aziza

texts.en:
Aziza is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.
For the past four years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition from other clothes sellers in the area. She dreams of expanding and establishing a cosmetics shop in the future.
With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase bundles of khangas (cloth) and cosmetics for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loan.use: To purchase bundles of "khanga"s (cloth) and cosmetics for resale.

loan.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children.
Julia has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.
Julia has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Julia hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loan.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 4 children. Rowena has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years.
She requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages. Rowena has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Rowena hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loan.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with five children who all go to school. She has additional family members. She operates a salon in a rented shop. She works seven days a week. She has been in business for five years.
She has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more cosmetics, braids and a hair dryer for her salon. Her major challenge is seasonality and defaulters. Her goal is to build rental houses in the future.
Joyce lives in her own house and her family has access to piped water and electricity. Her monthly expenses includes school fees.

loan.use: to buy more boxes of cosmetics, braids and a hair dryer for her salon

loan.name: Dionicio

texts.es: El seor Dionicio nacido en la localidad de Santa Rosa Chuquisaca vive con la Sra. Margarita, quien es ama de casa ya que tienen cinco hijos, y la Sra. Margarita se encarga de todos, cuentan con domicilio propio y se encuentra ubicada en el barrio 27 de mayo, viven en la zona hace 20 aos. El sr. Dionicio tiene como actividad principal moto taxista hace 10 aos ya que se dedica a esta labor, cuando no trabaja con su moto se dedica a la actividad de albail. El destino del prstamo es para comprar otra moto ya que la que tiene ya esta presentando algunas fallas no permitiendo que brinde un buen servicio a sus clientes. Se siente agradecido con la institucin por el apoyo que se le ha brindado.
texts.en: Mr. Dionicio was born in the town of Santa Rosa Chuquisaca. He lives with his wife Margarita who manages the household and cares for their five children. They live in a house in the May 27th neighborhood where they have lived for 20 years. Dionicio's principal occupation is as a mototaxi driver. He has worked as a taxi driver for ten years, but when he is not working as a driver he finds work as a mason. The loan will be used to purchase a new motorcycle because his current motorcycle is in need of repairs and he can no longer provide a good service to his clients. He is thankful for the support he has received from this institution.

loan.use: COMPRA DE UNA MOTOCICLETA

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loan.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a widowed woman with seven children, two of whom still attend school while five have graduated from school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.
For the past 10 years, she has owned rental houses, and her potential customers are tenants. Fatuma dreams of expanding and constructing more real estate rental homes in the future.
With the Kshs 10,000 loan, she wants to renovate her rental houses, purchase 10 bags of cement and pay for labor charges. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loan.use: to renovate her rental houses, purchase 10 bags of cement and pay for labor

loan.name: Evelyn

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SEOR DE WIMPILLAY CHOCCO; El banco est ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco, y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Evelyn; ella tiene 27 aos de edad y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de hamburguesas, ella prepara hamburguesas de carne, pollo y salchicha y lo vende en forma ambulatoria desde las 5:00 p.m hasta las 11:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el servicio de hamburguesas. La socia solicita el prstamo para comprar insumos para preparar las hamburguesas como carne, pollo, salchichas y panes al por mayor.
La socia est feliz por el prstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Seor de Wimpillay Chocco Communal Bank. The bank is located in the district of Cusco, which belongs to the province of Cusco and department of Cusco.
The member is Evelyn. She is 27 years old and lives with her partner and has three children. She alternates her daily activities with her business of selling hamburgers. She prepares hamburgers with beef, chicken, and sausage, and sells them on foot from 5 p.m. until 11 p.m.
Evelyn gets her children ahead with this business. She wants to expand and improve her hamburger service.
She is requesting the loan to buy supplies to make the hamburgers: beef, chicken, sausage, and bread wholesale.
Evelyn is happy about the loan and is committed to making the payments.

loan.use: to buy supplies to make the hamburgers: beef, chicken, sausage, and bread wholesale.

loan.name: Floriana

texts.en:
Floriana is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children.
Floriana has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.
Floriana has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Floriana hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loan.name: Carina

texts.en:
Carina is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with one child.
Carina has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.
Carina has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Carina hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loan.name: Angeles

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal SEOR DE WIMPILLAY CHOCCO; El banco est ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
