loan.use: to buy cows

loan.name: Sameera

texts.en: Sameera is a 46-year-old woman. She is married and has two sons and one daughter. One of her sons is a worker with a decent salary. Sameera wants to make interior improvements to her house such as fixing doors and windows, changing tiles etc, but the amount of money she has isn't enough to pay for the renovation, so she needs to take out a loan in the amount of $350 from FATEN. When Sameera gets the loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, she will be able to pay for the necessary interior improvements to her house which will provide better living conditions for her and her family. Sameera is photographed in the picture.

loan.use: To pay for interior improvements to her house.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to purchase a new computer.

loan.name: Samar

texts.en: Samar is a 33-year-old young woman (she is a conservative woman, so her husband is photographed instead). She is married and has two sons and two daughters. Her husband is a taxi driver making a low income; it is the only source of income the family has. Samar wants to help her husband with painting and licensing expenses for the taxi by taking out a loan of $1,000 from FATEN. When Samar gets the loan, to be repaid on a monthly basis, she will be able to share with her husband in paying for painting and licensing the taxi. This will make the taxi more efficient and her husband will work extra hours to get better income and provide better living conditions for the family.

loan.use: to pay for painting and licensing the taxi.

loan.name: Sawsan

texts.en: Sawsan is a 34-year-old lady who got married at the age of 19. She gave birth to two sons and one daughter. Her husband is a humble employee who receives an average salary at one of the Jordanian companies. Getting married at a young age and having children did not allow her to start her own business until recently, when she have decided to turn her artistic talent and vision into something physicA. by embroidering clothes such as Abaya and covers using different kinds and colors of beads. Now Sawsan has applied for a loan in order to expand her business and add new types of accessories on the clothes so she can one day have her own exhibition.

loan.use: to add new types of accessories on clothes.

loan.name: Sabria

texts.en:
Sabria is a 56-year-old woman. She is married and has four sons and two daughters; one of her sons is employed with a decent salary.
Sabria has a beauty salon and wants to purchase a new beauty salon kit such as hair products, creams, chairs, mirrors, etc., in order to improve her work. The amount of money Sabria has isn't enough to pay for it, so she needs to take a loan of $1,000 from FATEN. When Sabria gets the loan, which will be repaid on a monthly basis, she will purchase a new beauty salon kit and improve her work positively; in this way, she will increase her income and live in better life conditions with the family. Sabria is photographed in her salon.

loan.use: To pay for purchasing a new beauty salon kit to improve her work.

loan.name: Niveen

texts.en: Niveen is a 26-year-old young woman. She is married and has one son and one daughter. Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. Niveen has a project of raising laying hens and benefits from selling its products. Niveen wants to purchase more laying hens and expand her project to increase the family income. She has an amount of money that is not enough to pay for the hens, so she needs to take a loan of $1,000 from FATEN. When Niveen gets the loan, which will be repaid on a monthly basis, she will purchase more laying hens and increase her income by selling more of their products; this will provide Niveen and her family with better life conditions. Niveen is a conservative woman, so her husband is photographed instead.

loan.use: to purchase more laying hens.

loan.name: Regina

texts.en:
This is 34-year-old Regina. She is married and has two children, aged 5 and 8. In 2006, Regina established her clothing business. She began her business because she wanted to get a permanent source of income to help her husband provide a livelihood for their family. Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 1,200,000 Sierra Leone leone (Le) every month from this business.
She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Regina has already received and successfully repaid a loan, and now requires a new loan in order to buy different kinds of clothing for her business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 400,000. In the future, Regina plans to open her business in other areas within her township, hopes to grow to general overseer of her business and care for the needs of her family. She thanks you for your support.

loan.use: To buy different kinds of clothing for her business.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to pay for purchasing new carpentry tools.

loan.name: Alaa'

texts.en:
Alaa' is a 30 year old young woman. She is married and has two sons, her husband is a branch manager in a Palestinian association with a decent salary.
Alaa' wants to start a new project of her own to increase the family income and assist her husband in paying for their life expenses. She wants to open a beauty salon and wants to purchase a new beauty salon kit such as: chairs, mirrors, hair creams, different types of hair brushes, etc. Alaa' has an amount of money which is not enough to pay for these supplies. She needs to take a loan of amount $3,000 from FATEN. When Alaa' gets the loan which is to be repaid on a monthly basis, she will be able to purchase all of the supplies needed to start her beauty salon. This will enable Alaa' to start her project and increase her income to have better life conditions. Alaa' is photographed in the picture.

loan.use: to pay for purchasing a beauty salon kit.

loan.name: Amany

texts.en: Amany is a 21 year old young woman. She is married and has one son; her husband is employed with a decent salary.Amany wants to start a new project of a beauty salon and she needs to purchase a new beauty salon kit, such as: chairs, mirrors, hair creams, hair brushes, etc. The amount of money she has isn't enough to pay, so she needs to take a loan amount of $2,000 from FATEN. When Amany gets the loan which is repaid on a monthly basis, she will pay to purchase new beauty salon kit and open her project successfully, this will enable her to get better income and live in better life conditions. Amany is a conservative woman, so her husband is photographed instead in FATEN branch.

loan.use: to purchase a new beauty salon kit.

loan.name: Ibraheem

texts.en: Ibraheem is a 54 year old man. He is married and has four sons and three daughters. Two of his sons are workers with decent salaries. Ibraheem wants to share with his son in his wedding expenses. In order to pay part of these expenses, the amount of money he has isn't enough, so he needs to take a loan amount of $2,000 from FATEN. When Ibraheem gets the loan, which will be repaid on a monthly basis, he will be able to take part in his son's wedding expenses and share, with his son, in paying for the wedding. Ibraheem will be able to help his son to prepare well for his wedding and to provide better life conditions for the family. Ibraheem is photographed in the picture.

loan.use: to pay for his son wedding expenses.

loan.name: Huda

texts.en:
The 45 year old mother, Huda, has 8 daughters and 1 son. Her husband has already retired. In order to support this big family, Huda has worked in many fields with her husband, such as private teacher (home schooling), selling blankets, olive oil cans and cheese, each by its season.
Besides all her previous endeavors, Huda has been working as a tailor for 6 years, now at her house. She has applied for a loan to buy more material that will help her increase her productivity so that she can open her own tailoring workshop in the near future.

loan.use: To buy more material and fabric to increase her productivity so she can open her own tailoring workshop.

loan.name: Ludmila

texts.en: Ludmila is a businesswoman from Melitopol. She sells men's outerwear on one of the local markets which name is Obraztsoviy (Exemplary). Ludmila sells the merchandise for eight years. In the past, her friends aided her in choosing the direction in business. Right now she has 8,000 hrivna of working capital and her profit is 3,000 hrivna. Ludmila never sits in one plane and does not stop at what she has achieved. She constantly seeks on how to further develop her business. This time she is planning to use the 8,000 hrivna loan from Kiva to buy merchandise for the autumn and winter season, precisely to buy men's jackets for future resale in her kiosk on the market. She plans to use the earned profit to install gas equipment in her home.

loan.use: to buy merchandise for the autumn-winter season, precisely mens jackets to sell in own kiosk on the market

loan.name: Yekaterina

texts.en:
Yekaterina and her husband with two grown daughters live in Melitopol. She sells women's clothing on the local market near the train station. Yekaterina started her business twelve years ago. At this time she has 40,000 hrivna invested in her merchandise. Her clean profit is 5,000 hrivna.
Yekaterina plans to buy seasonal merchandise: women's clothing for the autumn and winter season and to sell it at reasonable prices. Her entrepreneurship and ability to run her business correctly allow Yekaterina to realize her goals and continue to expand her business by opening new locations to sell in the future.

loan.use: to buy seasonal merchandise: women's clothing for the autumn and winter season and sell it at reasonable prices

loan.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga is married and has two grown children. She lives and works in the city of Melitopol. Olga sells women's apparel and footwear in the central town market. She has been engaged in this business for nearly 17 years and believes that she has found an acceptable direction. At this point, she has 60,000 hryvnia worth of goods and her net income was 7,000 hryvnia.
Olga needs a loan of 20,000 hryvnia to buy seasonal women's clothing, to increase the range of products and to raise additional income to improve her household. In the future, Olga hopes to gradually expand her business and possibly open another outlet.

loan.use: to buy seasonal women's clothing, to increase the range of products and to raise additional income to improve her household.

loan.name: Mara Martha

texts.es:
La Seora. Mara es socia del banco comunal Las Flores, vive por la parroquia de Ricaurte lugar donde existe una gran variedad de comedores que ofrecen los platos tpicos del sector, su gente se dedica a la agricultura y cra de animales, mantienen las tradiciones y cultura de sus padres.
La Seora. Mara tiene 46 aos, es madre soltera de un hijo de 17 aos de edad que est estudiando en la universidad. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive con sus padres con quienes comparte los gastos del hogar.
Doa Mara tiene una una tienda de comestibles hace 6 aos, en la cual labora desde las 6 de la maana hasta las 10 de la noche.
En el banco comunal se encuentra hace 6 aos y los crditos le han permitido crecer en su negocio. El dinero de este crdito lo va a invertir en la compra de arroz, azcar, fideos, aceites y otros productos de primera necesidad para su tienda.
Su meta es que su hijo se gradu de la universidad y sea un gran profesional.
texts.en:
Mara is a member of the Las Flores communal bank. She lives in the Ricaurte parish, an area where there are a great variety of eateries that serve regional dishes. The locals work in agriculture and breed animals, maintaining the traditions and culture of their parents.
Mara is 46 years old and is a single mother of one 17 year old son who studies in the university. She doesnt have her own home and lives with her parents with whom she shares the household costs.
Mara has had a grocery store for 6 years, and she works from 6:00 in the morning until 10:00 at night.
She has been in the communal bank for 6 years, and the loans have allowed her to grow her business. She will invest the money from this loan into the purchase of rice, sugar, noodles, oils, and other essential products for her store.
Her goal is that her son will graduate from the university and become a successful professional.

loan.use: to buy rice, sugar, noodles, oils, and other essential products

loan.name: Yenny Melania

texts.es:
La Seora. Yenny es socia del banco comunal Las Flores, vive por la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que tiene una belleza arquitectnica, cultural y natural que cautiva a propios y extraos, cuenta con una gran variedad en su gastronoma, su gente es amable y muy cordial.
La Seora. Yenny tiene 32 aos, es casada y en su unin conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 10, 9 y 2 aos de edad, sus dos primeros hijos estn estudiando en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo es de profesin mecnico y labora en un taller que es de su propiedad, no tienen casa propia por lo que vive en casa de sus suegros de manera independiente.
Doa Yenny trabaja en una panadera medio da de lunes a sbados y lleva 8 meses en esta labor. El resto de su tiempo trabaja en la venta de cosmticos de la marca Yanbal y lleva 1 ao realizando esta actividad.
En el banco comunal se encuentra reingresando y su nuevo crdito lo va a invertir en la compra de perfumes, cremas, cosmticos y bisutera para incrementar su mercadera.
Su meta es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Yenny is a member of the Las Flores communal bank. She lives in the city of Cuenca, a city which has beautiful architecture, culture and nature that captivates both locals and visitors, and has a great variety of cuisine, and people who are friendly and cordial.
Yenny is 32 years old, and she and her husband have three children who are 10, 9, and 2 years old. Their first two children study in a small school in the city. Her spouse is a professional mechanic, and he works in a shop that he owns. They dont have their own home, and so they live with her parents in law independently.
Yenny works in a bakery from noon on Monday until Saturday. She has done this work for eight months. In the remainder of her time she works selling Yanbal brand cosmetics, and shes been in that business for one year.
She has re-joined the communal bank, and she will invest her new loan in the purchase of perfume, creams, cosmetics, and imitation jewelry to increase her merchandise.
Her goal is to have her own home.

loan.use: to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and imitation jewelry

loan.name: Zoila Rosa

texts.es:
La Seora. Zoila es socia del banco comunal Las Flores, vive por la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que tiene una belleza arquitectnica, cultural y natural que cautiva a propios y extraos, cuenta con una gran variedad en su gastronoma, su gente es amable y muy cordial.
Doa Zoila tiene 50 aos, es viuda y en su unin conyugal ha concebido 5 hijos, cuatro de ellos son casados e independientes y su ultima hija que tiene de 10 aos de edad est estudiando en una escuelita de la ciudad. La casa en la que habita es de su propiedad.
La Seora. Zoila se dedica a la venta de frutas por mayor y menor, tiene un puesto propio y lleva 25 aos en el negocio, trabaja de domingo a domingo empezando su jornada de trabajo desde las 3 de la maana hasta las 7 de la noche.
Este es su primer crdito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por su cuada. Su crdito lo va a invertir en la compra de frutas para continuar con el negocio.
Su meta es comprarse un vehculo.
texts.en:
Zoila is a member of the communal bank "Las Flores." She lives in the city of Cuenca, a city that has an architectural, cultural and natural beauty that captivates both locals and foreigners. The city has great variety in its cuisine, and friendly and cordial people.
Zoila is a 50 year-old widow. From her marriage she has 5 children, 4 of whom are married and independent. Her youngest daughter, 10, is studying in a small school in the city. She owns the house that she lives in.
Zoila has a business selling fruit at retail and wholesale. She has her own stall, and she has been in this business for 25 years. She works every day, starting her working day at 3 in the morning and working until 7 at night.
This is the first loan that she has taken with her communal bank. She joined the bank at the invitation of her sister-in-law. She will invest this loan in the purchase of fruits so that she can continue with her business.
Her goal is to buy herself a vehicle.

loan.use: to buy fruit

loan.name: Laura Alejandrina

texts.es:
La Seora. Laura es socia del banco comunal La Esquina, vive por la parroquia de Sinincay, esta parroquia tiene hermoso lugares en donde se puede observar la naturaleza, una gran variedad de platos tpicos, su gente mantiene la cultura y tradiciones, se caracterizan por ser personas amables y gentiles.
Doa Laura tiene 34 aos, es casada y en su unin conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos de 14, 13, 10 y 2 aos de edad, 2 estudian en el colegio y 1 en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora en el rea de la construccin como albail, la casa en la que viven es de su propiedad.
La Seora. Laura se dedica a la cra y venta de animales, ella tiene cuyes, pollos y en especial ganado, ella arrienda potreros para alimentar su ganado. Trabaja en esta labor ya que le da el tiempo para cuidar de sus hijos.
En el banco comunal se encuentra hace 5 aos y su nuevo crdito lo va a invertir para la compra de alimento para sus animales.
Su meta es comprar potreros para criar mas ganado.
texts.en:
Laura is a member of the communal bank "La Esquina." She lives in the Sinincay parish. Here one can find beautiful places to observe nature, a great variety of traditional dishes, and people who maintain their culture and traditions. The people here are known for their kindness and friendliness.
Laura is 34 years old and married. Her marriage has produced 4 children who are now aged 14, 13, 10 and 2. Two of the children are in school, and one is in an elementary school in the city. Her husband works in construction as a bricklayer. They own the home that they live in.
Laura has a business raising and selling animals. She raises guinea pigs, chickens, and especially cattle. She rents pasture lands to feed her livestock. She does this type of work because it gives her time to care for her children.
She has been a member of her communal bank for 5 years, and she will invest this new loan in the purchase of feed for her animals.
Her goal is to buy pasture land so that she can raise more livestock.

loan.use: to buy animal feed

loan.name: Hilda Yolanda

texts.es:
La Seora. Hilda es socia del banco comunal La Esquina, vive por la parroquia de Miraflores, esta parroquia tiene hermoso lugares en donde se puede observar la naturaleza, una gran variedad de platos tpicos, su gente mantiene la cultura y tradiciones, se caracterizan por ser personas amables y gentiles.
La Seora. Hilda tiene 23 aos, vive en unin libre y ha concebido 3 hijos de 6, 2 aos de edad y una beb de 7 meses, su primer hijo estudia en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora como empleado privado, no tienen casa propia por lo que vive con sus suegros y comparten los gastos del hogar.
La Seora. Hilda se dedica al cuidado de sus hijos que aun estn pequeos y como pasa en casa le da la oportunidad de criar pollos.
Este es su tercer crdito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y su alimento.
Su meta es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Seora Hilda is a member of the communal bank La Esquina. She lives in the parish of Miraflores. This parish has some beautiful spots where you can observe nature, a great variety of local dishes as well as friendly and kind people who maintain their culture and traditions.
Seora Hilda is 23 years old and lives in a common-law marriage. She has 3 children, 6 and 2 years of age and a 7 month old baby. Her first child attends a small school in the city. Her husband works as a private employee. They do not own their own house and so live with their in-laws and share the household expenses.
Seora Hilda takes care of her children at home as they are still small and this gives her the opportunity of raising chickens.
This is her third loan with the communal bank and with it she is going to purchase chickens and chicken feed.
Her goal is to have her own house.

loan.use: to buy chickens and chicken feed.

loan.name: Rosa Etelvina

texts.es:
La Seora. Rosa es socia del banco comunal La Esquina, vive por la parroquia de Miraflores, esta parroquia tiene hermoso lugares en donde se puede observar la naturaleza, una gran variedad de platos tpicos, su gente mantiene la cultura y tradiciones, se caracterizan por ser personas amables y gentiles.
Doa Rosa tiene 60 aos, es casada y en su unin conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos quienes son mayores de edad, uno es casado e independiente y su hija soltera trabaja y le ayuda econmicamente. Su esposo labora como jornalero, la casa en la que habita es de su propiedad.
La Seora. Rosa se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y como pasa en casa cra pollos, cerdos y cuyes. Tambin tiene una tienda de comestibles en la cual trabaja sin un horario fijo y de domingo a domingo.
En el banco comunal se encuentra en su cuarto crdito y lo va a invertir para la compra de arroz, azcar, aceites, detergentes, fideos y otros productos de primera necesidad para su tienda.
Su meta es crecer y agrandar su tienda.
texts.en:
Seora Rosa is a member of the communal bank La Esquina. She lives in the parish of Miraflores. This parish has some beautiful spots where you can observe nature, a great variety of local dishes as well as friendly and kind people who maintain their culture and traditions.
Doa Rosa is 60 years old, married and has 2 children who are both adults; one is married and independent whilst her daughter is single and works, helping her mother economically. Her husband works as a daily labourer. The house they live in is their own property.
Seora Rosa takes care of her household chores and so as she spends time at home she raises chickens, pigs and guinea pigs. She also has a grocery store where she works without a fixed schedule Sunday to Sunday.
She is in her 4th loan cycle with the communal bank and with it she is going to purchase rice, sugar, oils, detergents, noodles and other staple products for her store.
Her goal is to grow her business and enlarge her store.

loan.use: to buy rice, sugar, oils, detergents and other staple products

loan.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is married with 6 children, is 48 years old and lives in Danlugan, Pagadian City.
Dolores has a business buying and selling livestock, and earns approximately PHP 35,000 each month doing this type of work. She has a requested loan of 35,000 to purchase a goat and cow for her business.
Dolores has been a member of PMPC for more than 5 years. And in the future, Dolores hopes to have her own Piggery.

loan.use: to purchase a goat and cow for her livestock business

loan.name: Tunas Mekar Asih Group

texts.en:
The Tunas Mekar Asih group has had five loans. This loan is again used to support their efforts in breeding pigs. Three members of the group stopped for various reasons: some moved away with their husbands, others already have enough capital so they do not need to borrow any more.
Ni Ketut will use the loan to buy three piglets. Currently the price of piglets is very expensive, 500,000 Rupiah (IDR) per piglet. She and the other members of the Tunas Mekar Asih group hope the loan amount in the next period can be increased so that their businesses can develop. Ni Ketut and the rest of the group members hope this effort will advance their businesses so that they can become independent and not need to borrow any more.

loan.use: To buy three piglets

loan.name: San Valentin Group

texts.es: San Valentin es el comit integrado por 10 mujeres de la ciudad de Santan. Todas ellas son vecinas y amigas de esa ciudad. Todas las integrantes del comit desarrollan actividades independientes, las cuales la ayudan con el sustento de su familia. Lograron formar un grupo que trabaja en equipo, siempre dentro de un marco de respeto y mutuo apoyo. Una de las miembros es la seora Mara, ella se dedica hace un tiempo a la cra y posterior venta de animales. Este ha sido el sustento de su familia por un tiempo, con el mismo logra darles las condiciones mnimas para una vida digna y sin privaciones. Comenta que es un trabajo muy duro y sacrificado, pues requiere mucho esfuerzo fsico. Ella solicita el crdito para la compra de animales pequeos para la posterior venta y como as tambin alimento para los mismos.
texts.en:
The 'San Valentin' committee has ten [female] members who all come from the town of Santan. They are all neighbors and friends from this town. All of the members have their own individual business activities which help them to support their families. They managed to create a group where they work as a team, within a framework of respect and mutual support.
One of the members of this committee is Mara, who raises and sells animals. This has been the source of support for her family for some time. Through her business, she manages to provide her family with the minimum conditions for a decent life without hardship. She tells us that it is very hard work as it requires a lot of physical effort.
Mara is requesting this loan to buy animals which she will later sell. She will also buy feed for the animals.

loan.use: to buy animals and animal feed

loan.name: Faustina

texts.en:
Faustina is 58 years old and is married. They are blessed with 10 children. The youngest two are in school and are about to finish college this year. Faustinas husband is a farmer, planting rice and corn in the Philippines.
Faustina is engaged in a hog raising business, primarily hogs for breeding. She has six heads of sow and 40 piglets to raise. Sometimes, Faustina has difficulties in feeding her plenty of pigs, thats why she decided to request a loan of P50,000 to buy feed for the maintenance of her pigs. She plans also to buy galvanized iron to repair the roof top of her piggery house.
She hopes to maintain her business for the future of her family. She will manage her business well, and gain higher income to save some of it for their future emergencies.

loan.use: to buy feed for her pigs.

loan.name: Pigy Lestari Group

texts.en:
The Pigy Lestari group is made up of 10 women who are neighbors in the same village in Melaya, West Bali. The group is seeking a loan of 10,000,000 Rupiah (IDR); each member will receive 1,000,000 IDR. The group was formed out of these women's common interest in raising pigs to supplement family income, and out of their interest in learning the best practices for pig raising.
Ni Komang is the head of the Pigy Lestari group. She is married and has one child, who is already married. Her husband earns money as a farmer, but Ni Komang would like to help support her family with her pig raising business. She plans to sell the piglets after six months for use as fattening pigs. With the increase in household income, she hopes to be able to fix her kitchen and increase her savings.

loan.use: To purchase piglets

loan.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es: 13 mujeres de la ciudad de Santan se unieron con el propsito de ayudar a sus familias por medio de su trabajo. Ellas desean que sus hijos y familiares no tengan que pasar por las mismas privaciones que ellas, es por eso que deciden organizarse y entrar al programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la Fundacin Paraguaya. Una de las integrantes del grupo es la seora Matilde, ella se dedica a la carnicera, en su negocio vende todo tipo de cortes de carnes. Comenta que lleva un tiempo en esto, por lo que ya tiene una clientela bien formada que siempre acuden hasta ella. Por medio de este negocio ella logra salir y sacar adelante a su familia. Ella solicita el crdito para la compra de cortes de carnes, costillas vacunas y dems, con lo cual podr abastecerse y cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes. Agradece a la Fundacin por la oportunidad que esta les brinda como grupo.
texts.en:
13 women from the city of Santan came together with the plan of helping their families through their work. They want their children and relatives not to have to go through the same privations that they have done, and this is why they have decided to organize themselves and enter Fundacin Paraguaya's program for entrepreneurial women.
One of the group's members is Seora Matilde. She works as a butcher, selling all types and cuts of meat. She comments that it has taken a while, but she has a solid customer base who always go to her. By means of this business, she has been able to succeed and move her family ahead in life.
She is requesting this loan for the purchase of cuts of meat, beef ribs, and more, with which she can stock up and meet her customers' orders. She is grateful to the Foundation for the opportunity which is being provided to this group.

loan.use: to buy cuts of meat for later sale.

loan.name: La Alegria Group

texts.es: El comit La Alegria se form con la unin de varias vecinas de la comunidad de Santan. Todas las integrantes formaron un grupo muy unido y capaz de realizar conjuntamente actividades que fortalecen su compaerismo. Ellas comentan que se unieron con el propsito de poder generar mayores ingresos para sus familias. Una de las integrantes es la seora Ana, ella se dedica a la cra y posterior venta de animales. Este trabajo lo realiza hace ya un buen tiempo, dice que esto no es tarea fcil, pues debe de estar siempre pendiente de sus animales para que no les pase nada ni les falte nada, pero comenta que es muy gratificante para ella que por medio de este trabajo logra mantener a sus familiares, pues desea darles a ellos una vida sin privaciones. Ella solicita el crdito para la compra de balanceados para sus animales, con lo cual podr asegurar el alimento de los mismos.
texts.en:
The La Alegria committee was created by several neighbors from the community of Santan. They created a very united group whose members are capable of jointly carrying out activities that strengthen their team spirit. They tell us that they came together with the goal of making more income for their families.
One of the members of this committee is Ana, whose business is raising and selling animals. She has been in this line of work for a long time now. She tells us that it is not easy work because she always needs to be alert to her animals' needs, so that nothing happens to them and so that there is nothing they lack. However, she tells us that it is also rewarding because, through this work, she manages to support her family members who she would like to offer a life without hardship.
Ana is requesting this loan to buy nutritionally-balanced feed for her animals, to ensure that they are well fed.

loan.use: to buy nutritionally-balanced animal feed

loan.name: Guljazi

texts.en:
Guljazi is 39 years old and lives with her five sons and husband in a ger, a traditional Mongolian yurt, in Bayan-Ulgii province of Mongolia. Her eldest three children are high school students.
She started her business in 2008 by selling clothes at the local market. Her family members now help her to manage the business. Her business is the only income source for the family. She is a diligent and hard-working woman who says "I want to earn more profits to educate my children very well. This is my main goal of life." She is requesting a 2,800,000 MNT loan to buy more clothes and to increase her business turnover.

loan.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loan.name: Probo

texts.en:
Probo is 33 years old, married and has two school aged children. His wife is a teacher who already has nine years in this service. Probo has run a hog raising business for almost seven years. He has five sow and seven pigs for fattening.
Probo is requesting a loan of P25,000 to buy feed for the maintenance of his pigs. He needs additional capital to cope with the increasing price of feed nowadays. He plans to improve his practices in taking care of his sow to gain higher profits through the piglets he sells. Probo says that this will help him uplift their living.
Probo dreams to finish their children's education till college. He has no other wealth to give to his children, other than education.

loan.use: to buy feed for his pigs.

loan.name: Mariya

texts.en:
Mariya is 40 years old and lives with her children in a ger (traditional Mongolian yurt) in Bayan-Ulgii province of Mongolia. Her two children are high school students.
She started her business in 2006 by selling milk at the retail price. Since then she continued her business. She started her business with 500,000 MNT. Now her daily income is between 15,000 MNT to 20,000 MNT and 30-35% of this income is a net profit. With her business profit, she paid the college tuition fees of her two children. She certainly pays a lots of attention their education.
She is a diligent woman who says "I want to give good education to my children." She is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to increase her turnover capital and buy more dairy products.

loan.use: To buy more dairy products to sell

loan.name: Teratai Indah Group

texts.en:
Like many Balinese women, Sayu Komang and the other members of the Teratai Indah group raise pigs in their yards to supplement their families 'incomes. Through many women support their families in this way, they may not know the best way to raise pigs to maximize income. Sayu Komang hopes that, through the MUK Pig Breeder Loan Program, she will not only get capital but will also get training from MUK on the best way to feed and care for pigs.
Sayu Komang will use her share of the loan to purchase piglets and pig feed. She plans to sell the piglets after six months for use as pork. With her profits, she will help support her family of three by supplementing the income of her husband, who works as a farmer. Ultimately, Sayu Komang hopes that increased income will enable her to pay school fees.

loan.use: To purchase piglets and pig feed

loan.name: Amarjargal

texts.en:
Amarjargal is 43 years old and a hard-working woman who lives with her family in an outer 'ger' district (a district without basic infrastructure) of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. She has four children aged from 2 to 18; her spouse works at a local company, while their children are enrolled in school except their elder daughter. Their elder daughter helps her to operate the family business.
Since 2008, Amarjargal has been operating a clothing business with two small stalls at the largest outdoor market of Mongolia. When she started her business she had a lower working capital, but today its increased and has become 2.1 million MNT (Mongolian Tugriks).
Amarjargal imports her clothes from Ereen, a border city between Mongolia and China, twice in a month. Autumn is very high shopping season in our country, therefore she needs to buy more clothes to sell. With her business income she is planning to pay tuition fees for her daughter who studies at the state university. So Amarjargal is requesting a 1,200,000 MNT loan to purchase more clothes imported from Ereen to sell in the two small stalls.

loan.use: To purchase more clothes to sell in her two small stalls.

loan.name: San Francisco Group

texts.es: En la ciudad D. Paraguar, se reunieron un grupo D. mujeres con el fin D. capitalizar su actividad y otras para emprender actividades productivas, D. ah que coordinaron una reunin para interiorizarse sobre el programa D. mujeres emprendedoras D. la Fundacin, el cual les result muy interesante por los beneficios que les otorgara el programa. El comit lleva por nombre San Francisco ya que las mismas viven en el barrio del mismo nombre, ellas se han caracterizado por la unidad en el grupo, su dinamismo y respeto mutuo quienes por medio D. este emprendimiento fortalecern el lazo entre ellas, actualmente se encuentran en el segundo ciclo con calificacin excelente, integrada por 17 emprendedoras seoras, quienes ponen lo mejor D. s para aumentar sus ingresos y por enD. brindarle lo mejor a sus respectivas familias. Una D. las miembros es la seora Lilian, ella se dedica a la venta D. prendas D. todo, negocio que le deja buenos ingresos. Comenta que gracias a este trabajo y a su duro e incansable esfuerzo ella logra mantener a su familia y paliar los gastos que diariamente surgen en el seno familiar. Ella solicita el crdito para la compra D. prendas D. todo tipo como ser pantalones, jeans, camisas y dems, para que D. esa forma pueda ampliar el stock D. sus mercaderas.
texts.en:
In the town of Paraguar, a group of women joined together with the aim of capitalizing their existing businesses and, in some cases, starting new businesses. They arranged a meeting in order to find out more about the 'Entrepreneurial Women' Program run by Fundacin Paraguaya. They were very interested in the benefits offered to them through the program. This committee is called 'San Francisco' as its members live in a neighborhood of the same name. The women are noted for the unity of their group, their energy and their respect for one another. Through this undertaking, they will strengthen the links between them. The group are currently in their second loan cycle and have an excellent record. The group is maD. up of 17 entrepreneurial ladies who do their very best to increase their income and thereby proviD. their respective families with the very best.
One of the members of this group is Lilian. She sells all kinds of clothing and her business makes her good income. She tells us that, thanks to her hard work and untiring efforts, she manages to support her family and alleviate the expenses that crop up in the bosom of her family.
Lilian is requesting this loan to buy all kinds of clothing such as pants, jeans, shirts, etc. so that she can expand her stock of merchandise.

loan.use: to buy clothes to sell

loan.name: Batsaikhan

texts.en:
Batsaikhan is 43 years old and lives with her spouse and daughter in their own ger, a traditional Mongolian felt tent, in the outer ger district /district without basic infrastructure/ of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. Her daughter studies at the local university.

Batsaikhan has been operating a clothing retail business at the largest outdoor market in Mongolia since 2000. Expanding her business has led to increased profits which have enabled her to buy a small plot of land and a car and to start the work of building her house. Her spouse operates another small stall at the same market.

Batsaikhan is requesting a 2.000.000 MNT /Mongolian Tugriks/ loan to purchase more clothes to sell this fall, which is the high shopping season. In the future, she wants to expand her business more, increase her working capital, and finish her housing work.

loan.use: to purchase more clothes to sell this fall.

loan.name: Pana

texts.en:
Pana is 49 years old and lives with her daughter and husband in a house in Bayan-Ulgii province of Mongolia. All her children are living separately, except her youngest daughter. She moved to the town three years ago. She started her business two years ago by making and tailoring clothes.
Her income is sufficient to cover the family and business costs. She makes clothes and felt covers for yurts, traditional Mongolian houses, at her home. She is a diligent woman who says "My daugther is just graduated from the school. I want to also share my work with her and inherit my business to her."
She is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase sewing materials for her business.

loan.use: To purchase sewing materials

loan.name: Alegria Group

texts.es: El comit Alegria tiene 1 ao de formacin y trabajo con la Fundacin Paraguaya, todas las miembros son vecinas y amigas de esa ciudad. Ellas anhelan un futuro mejor para sus hijos es por eso que se esfuerzan el doble para facilitarles los materiales para su desarrollo y formacin. La seora Faustina es modista, se desempea en este oficio hace ya un buen tiempo, comenta que ella realiza muy buenos trabajos, por lo cual personas del barrio y zonas aledaas acuden hasta ella para hacerle pedidos de costuras o acercarle otro tipo de trabajo. Ella dice que gracias a este trabajo y al sacrificio diario ella logra mantener a su familia y cubrir los gastos diarios. Ella solicita el prstamo para la compra de telas, hilos y dems insumos necesarios para su taller de costura. Est muy agradecida con la Fundacin por la oportunidad que esta le da, a ella y a todo su grupo.
texts.en:
The Alegria committee was formed a year ago and works with Fundacin Paraguaya. All the member are neighbors and friends from this city. They crave a better future for their children, which is why they are working with doubled efforts to put in place what they need for their development and training.
Seora Faustina is a dressmaker. She has been working in this trade for quite a while, and comments that she does very good work, so that people from the neighborhood and the surrounding neighborhoods come to her with their orders for sewing or bringing her other types of work. She say that thanks to this work and her daily self-sacrifice, she has been able to support her family and cover her daily expenses.
She is requesting the loan to buy fabric, thread, and other necessary supplies for her sewing workshop. She is very grateful to the Fundacin for the opportunity they are giving, both to her and to the whole group.

loan.use: to buy fabric, thread and other supplies.

loan.name: Anonymous Group
loan.use: to buy silver and gold.

loan.name: Huatbek

texts.en:
Huatbek is 37 years old and lives with his children and wife in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Bayan-Ulgii province of Mongolia. His children are both high school students. His wife helps him to manage the family business.
He started his business few years ago by selling flour and rice at the local market. From 2010, he started to sell foods and other items. Currently, he is also managing another business, by selling fermented mare's milk. He has livestock in the countryside.
He is a diligent and optimistic man who says "I want to expand my business and increase my turnover." He is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase hay for his livestock. He planned to buy two truck loads of hay at the cost of 600,000 MNT and 20 bags of wheat at the cost of 1,000,000 MNT and finish the construction of a fence.

loan.use: To purchase hay and wheat

loan.name: Onalhan

texts.en:
Onalhan is 45 years old and lives with his children and wife in a ger, a tradiional Mongolian yurt, in Bayan-Ulgii province of Mongolia. Two of his children are high school students. His wife has a job. Their other child goes to the kindergarden.
He started his business in 1995 by selling food and other products at the local market. He is already well positioned in the market. His working capital was increased. He never took a loan from the bank. In 2010, he spent a significant amount of money for medical care.
He is a diligent man who says "I want to expand my business and increase my turnover." He is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to buy products for his business.

loan.use: To buy products to sell

loan.name: Natividad De Maria Group

texts.es: Este Comit se form gracias a una D. las miembros. Este es un grupo muy bueno, todas las mujeres son muy trabajadoras y responsables. Todas las del grupo tambien todas son mujeres que siguen adelante con sus emprendimientos con mucho esfuerzo y dedicacin y su mayor anhelo es sacar adelante sus negocios a sus hijos y tambien a ellas mismas y por tal agradecen a la Fundacion por la oportunidad que les da. La seora Marta se dedica a la venta D. frutas, comenta que su trabajo es un poco cansador, pero le gusta lo que hace. Ella por medio D. su trabajo sacrificado ha podido salir adelante con toda su familia, ya que gracias a este trabajo ella logra mantenerlos. Comenta que tiene muchos clientes que siempre acuden a ella en busca D. las frutas que venD.. Ella solicita el crdito para la compra D. manzanas, pias, bananas, duraznos y otras frutas, con lo cual podr abastecerse y cumplir con la demanda D. sus clientes.
texts.en:
This committee was formed thanks to one of the members. Its a very good group; all the women are very hardworking and responsible. All of the members of the group are also women who continue forward with their enterprises with much effort and dedication and their greatest wish is to succeed with their businesses and move their children, as well as themselves, forward. Because of this they thank the Fundacin for the opportunity it gives them.
Marta is a fruit vendor. She comments that her work is a bit tiring but she likes what she does. Through her demanding work shes been able to get ahead together with her entire family because thanks to this work shes able to support them. She comments that she has many customers who always seek her out in search of the fruit she sells.
She asks for the loan to buy apples, pineapples, bananas, peaches and other fruit to stock up and meet customer demand.

loan.use: to buy fruit for subsequent resale.

loan.name: Tsetsegmaa

texts.en:
Tsetsegmaa is 50 years old and lives with her children and husband in a ger, a traditional Mongolian yurt, in Huvsgul province of Mongolia. Her three children are working in Ulaanbaatar city. Her husband used to work as a driver and has not worked since 2000.
She graduated from the technological training center, majoring in fashion and sewing in 1980. She worked at the local fashion house as a tailor for 20 years. After she retired from work, she started her own sewing business. She has no work partner so far. In the future, she plans to expand her business operation by increasing her turnover and hiring one worker.
She is an open-minded and hard working person who says "If I have a collateral, it would be easy for me to take bank loans and increase the business turnover. I want to expand my business very well." She is requesting a 750,000 MNT to increase her working capital and purchase cloth and materials.

loan.use: To purchase cloth and materials

loan.name: Nazeeran's Group

texts.en:
Nazeeran supports her husband by operating a business sewing clothes. She learnt about this art from her mother and now she has become very skillful in her work and operating it independently. Her good sewing works allows her to receive regular orders every month.
Her husband is involved in an agriculture profession. He is basically a farmer and works in the field. He grows different seasonal crops and sells to the required customers for profit. Nazeeran has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah because her husband wants to buy farming supplies such as pesticides, seeds and fertilizer for the further expansion of his business.
She is confident that an investment will help her husband get better crops and earn more profit.

loan.use: To buy farm supplies such as pesticides, seeds and fertilizer

loan.name: 03.08.85 Thiu Ton Thiu Ha Group

texts.en:
Chin works in agriculture, raising poultry andcattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby cattle to raise and sell in the future. Chin is 44 years old and she is married with 3 children. She is the group leader of the 85 Thiu Ton solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. She lives with one dependent, and works in the Thiu Ha district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.
In 2003, she joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Chin has successfully repaid 7 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. With her business profit, Chin hopes to maintain a successful business, to remodel her house, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loan.use: to purchase baby cattle to raise and sell in the future.

loan.name: 03.08.86 Thiu Ton Thiu Ha Group

texts.en:
Chanh works in agriculture raising poultry andcattle. She is 52 years old and she is married with 3 children. She lives and works in Thiu Ha district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents.
She is requesting a loan to purchase baby cattle to raise and sell in the future. Chanh has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital.
In 2003, Chanh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She is the group leader of the 86 Thiu Ton solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. She has successfully repaid 7 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
With her business profit, Chanh hopes to maintain a successful business, to buy a motorbike, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loan.use: to purchase baby livestock cattle to raise and sell in the future.

loan.name: Sarsenbek

texts.en:
Sarsenbek is 36 years old and lives with his three children and wife in a ger (a Mongolian yurt), in Bayan-Ulgii province of Mongolia. His three children are high school students. His wife stays at home. He started his business in 2001 by herding livestock in the countryside. He still owns some livestock there.
He moved to the local area from the countryside in 2009. He has been driving a taxi from Ulgii town to Bayan-Nuur town. He owns the taxi car. When he goes on taxi service, he earns 300,000 MNT per round trip as net profit. He goes on these trips twice a week and repairs his car once a month.
He is a diligent and energetic man who says, "I want to expand my business and improve my life. Well, this is my life goal." He is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase spare parts to repair his car.

loan.use: To purchase spare parts.

loan.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es: El Seor Juan, tiene 36 aos, es soltero, tiene un hijo que esta viviendo con el, vino de Asuncin para trabajar en una empresa de esta ciudad, de ah paso a abrir su propia empresa. El tiene un local donde se dedica a la colocacin y venta de parabrisas. Comenta que su negocio le genera muy buenos ingresos y que gracias a esto puede mantenerse y mantener los gastos de la casa y tambin a su hijo. Dice que su negocio tiene mucho xito y que eso le genera un poco mas de ingresos, por lo cual le gustara poder seguir invirtiendo en el, para que de esa forma vaya creciendo mas y mas en el mercado. El solicita el crdito para la compra de parabrisas, el cual es el elemento esencial de su negocio. Agradece a la Fundacin por la oportunidad que esta le brinda.
texts.en:
Juan, 36 years old, is single. He has one son who is living with him. He came from Asuncin to work in a business from that city, and from there he opened his own business.
He has a shop where he installs and sells windshields. He says that his business generates very good profits for him, and that thanks to this he can support himself, pay the household expenses, and support his son. He says that his business is very successful and it generates a bit of profit for him. For this reason he would like to continue investing in it, so that it may grow more and more in the market.
He is asking for the loan to purchase windshields, the essential element of his business. He thanks the Fundacin for the opportunity it is giving him.

loan.use: to purchase windshields to sell

loan.name: 03.08.87 Thiu Ton Group

texts.en:
Thun works in agriculture raising poultry andcattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby cattle to raise and sell in the future. She has been involved in this business for 9 years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital.
She is 45 years old and she is married with 2 children. She lives and works in the Thiu Ha district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with 1 dependent.
In 2003, Thun joined the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid 7 loans from the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She is the group leader of the 87 Thiu Ton solidarity group, which consists of 4 members.
With her business profit, Thun hopes to provide for her kid, to remodel her house, and to be healthy and happy.

loan.use: to purchase baby livestock cattle to raise and sell in the future.

loan.name: Salyika's Group

texts.en:
Salyika is the leader of this group. She is 64, and unfortunately she is a widow. She has raised two sons and a daughter. The older son and the daughter are married and they live separately with their families. The younger son works in construction, and he lives together with his mom and takes care of her.
Eight years ago, with an initial investment of 700 soms, Salyika started to sell milk. She sells about 40-50 liters a day and the monthly profit from the trade is about 10,000 soms. With money received from the loan, Salyika wants to purchase more milk in the village and then resell it at the higher price in the city.
She needs some money to start repairing her house. In the future, Salyika wishes to purchase a vehicle for her younger son.
--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loan.use: to purchase more milk for resale.

loan.name: Shijir

texts.en: Shijir is 35 years old and lives with his three children and wife in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Zavhan Province, Mongolia. His eldest daughter goes to high school, and his two sons go to kindergarden. His wife is currently unemployed and sometimes sells livestock. He started his business in 2007 by transporting goods and products between cities. Before, he used to drive a truck. He switched the truck for a minivan. He is a diligent and hardworking man who says, "I do my best to bring good service to my clients. I also want to provide a good education and good living conditions for my children." He is requesting a 2,000,000-Mongolian-tugrik (MNT) loan to purchase goats.

loan.use: to purchase goats

loan.name: Gricelda Paola

texts.es: La seorita Gricelda, es de la Ciudad de Pilar. Se trata de una chica que vive hace mas de 18 aos en la ciudad en casa de sus tos. Ella es la encargada de esa casa y no paga alquiler solo corre con los gastos de servicios bsicos. Esta cursando el primer ao de la carrera de Administracin en la Universidad Privada San Lorenzo. Trabaja como vendedora para la empresa Industria y Hogar, hace 1 ao, y seis meses. Ella es soltera, sin hijos es la mayor de dos hermanos. Los mismos son menores y viven con sus padres en Espaa. Es una persona muy trabajadora amable y emprendedora con ganas de superarse cada da. Ella solicita el crdito para el pago de las cuotas de su universidad, como as tambin para compra de libros y materiales didcticos. Ella est muy agradecida con la fundacin por la oportunidad, ya que lo que mas desea ella es poder seguir estudiando para terminar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Seorita Gricelda is from the city of Pilar. She is a young woman who has lived for more than 18 years in this city in her uncle and aunt's house. She is in charge of the house and pays no rent, only the cost of basic services. She is in her first year of an administration degree in the private University of San Lorenzo. She has worked for the last year and a half as a salesperson for the company Industria y Hogar.
She is single, without children and is the eldest sibling. Her two brothers are minors and live with her parents in Spain. She is a very hardworking, enterprising and friendly person with a desire to excel and improve every day.
She is asking for the loan to pay for her university fees as well as buy books and teaching materials. She is very grateful to the Fundacion for the opportunity as what she most wants is to be able to continue studying to complete her degree.

loan.use: to buy school supplies as well as pay for tuition and books.

loan.name: Ma.menaliza

texts.en:
Ma.Menaliza describes herself as kind, simple, and responsible. She is a mother who is now 47 years old and has three school-age children. She owns and manages a variety store in their village to supplement her husband's income. Since their children are now in college, they are suffering financial shortages due to the high cost of school fees, commodities, and transportation. Despite this, they have a strong determination to uplift their standard of living and educate their children through patience and hard work.
Motivated by this, Ma.Menaliza aimed to sell more grocery items to earn a higher income, but she does not have enough capital. Therefore, she is asking for additional capital amounting to 9,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy additional stocks of soft drinks, chocolates, breads, beverages, noodles, soaps, and seasonings to sell in her variety store. She believes that through this loan she will be able to improve the business and increase her income to support the education of their children. In the future, she is hoping that her business will grow and their children will earn a degree.

loan.use: to buy additional stocks of soft drinks, chocolates, breads, beverages, noodles, soaps, and seasonings to sell in her variety store

loan.name: Juan De Dios

texts.es: El Seor Juan es soltero, tiene 35 aos de edad, vive en pareja con 2 hijos menores de edad, reside en la ciudad de Curuguaty, en su casa propia. Es propietario de una parada de Taxi, cuenta con un auto a su nombre, en cual trabaja todos los das cubriendo un itinerario de Curuguaty Ciudad del Este. Con una experiencia de 5 aos en el rubro en forma independiente, ya que antes trabajaba como personal cumpliendo la funcin de conductor en el mismo rubro. Los pobladores de algunos lugares optan por el servicio de Taxis ya que no hay colectivos que cubren directo. Tambin por el confort y la rapidez. El solicita el crdito para el mantenimiento de su taxi, ya que este es el medio de su trabajo y su principal fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
Juan is 35 years old and single. He lives with his partner (unmarried) and his two dependent children. He lives in the town of Curuguaty, in his own home. He owns a taxi stand and has a car in his name which he uses for work every day, covering a route between Curuguaty and Ciudad del Este. He has five years experience of working independently in this line of work. He used to work as a driver in the same field but as a member of staff, working for somebody else.
The locals in some of these places choose to use a private taxi service as there aren't collective taxis (those with a fixed route and fare) that run direct. They also choose a private taxi service for the comfort and speed.
Juan is requesting a loan to have his taxi serviced as it is his work tool and also his main source of income.

loan.use: to have his taxi serviced

loan.name: Marina

texts.en:
This is Marina, 30, a resident of Manila in the Philippines. She is married to Agapito, a welder, and mother to their two children. Both are still studying in elementary school. She and her husband manages their own household while operating the business. At this time she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.
Marina operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which sells groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns income by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Aside from this she also sells frozen chicken and pork. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 600 in sales every day.
To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 26,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.
Marina hopes her business grows into a mini-grocery and dreams to be able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.
* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loan.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loan.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
This is Rebecca, 49, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Marlon, a tricycle driver, and mother to their four children. With the help of her husband and children, she manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.
Rebecca operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, five pesos' worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns a profit by getting supplies at wholesale prices and reselling them by the piece. Aside from this, she also sells processed meat. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day.
To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a 43,000-PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.
Rebecca hopes her business will grow more this coming year, so she'll be able to have their house renovated. She dreams of being able to give her children a high-quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her fellowship* co-members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.
* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loan.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business

loan.name: Battsetseg

texts.en: Battsetseg is 52 years old and lives with her two daughters and husband in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Zavhan Province, Mongolia. Her two daughters are currently unemployed. Her husband repairs cars. She started her business in 2000 by selling vegetables. She has been selling vegetables since then. In the beginning, she used to sell them at an open space. Now, she rents a commercial space at the local market and pays 26,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) per month. She purchased a storage house and truck for her business with her profits. She pays lots of attention to her children and their future. She is a diligent and hardworking woman who says, "I am very satisfied with my business and its future prospects. I have a plan to expand my business." She is requesting a 750,000-MNT loan to purchase vegetables and store them when the price is cheap.

loan.use: to purchase vegetables

loan.name: Alejandrina

texts.es: La Seora Alejandrina tiene 53 aos de edad, est casada con el Seor Cornelio hace ms de 30 aos, tienen dos hijos juntos, todos ya mayores de edad. Esta seora es muy emprendedora, teje frazadas y manteles artesanales y su marido se encarga de venderlos a cuotas en la localidad de Villarrica en donde viaja cada mes a colocar y cobrar sus productos, gracias a su trabajo y esfuerzo pudo brindarles a sus hijos todas las comodidades y a la vez hacerles estudiar. Comenta que ahora todo su trabajo ya es para poder tener una vejez digna y sin privaciones. Solicita el prstamo para la compra de hilos y color para tejer Frazadas que en sta temporada y le solicitan mucho sus clientes. Agradece a la Fundacin por la oportunidad que esta le da de seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Alejandrina, 53, has been married to Cornelio for over 30 years; they have two children together, both now adults.
This lady is very enterprising. She weaves blankets and artisanal tablecloths. Her husband takes care of selling them in Villarrica where he goes monthly to sell the products and to collect payment for them. Thanks to her work and effort she was able to provide her children with comfort and at the same time see that they got an education. She comments that now all her works purpose is that she has a proper old age thats free of want.
Shes asking for the loan to buy colored thread to weave blankets that are in season and being much requested by her customers. She thanks the Fundacin for the opportunity it gives her to continue growing.

loan.use: to buy colored embroidery and weaving thread.

loan.name: Enhbaatar

texts.en:
Enhbaatar is 28 years old and lives with his two children and wife in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in the Tosontsengel province of Mongolia. His wife helps him to manage the family business.
He started his business in 2010 by selling food and other products in his hometown. He is very encouraged with his business growth and expansion. He believes that he will be a successful businessman in the near future.
He is a diligent and hard-working man who says, "I want to develop and expand my business with the bank loan. I also have a plan to buy a car for my business and family. I think this is only the start of everything."
He is requesting a 3,500,000 MNT loan to buy construction materials to build the grocery shop.

loan.use: To buy construction materials.

loan.name: Kurbonali

texts.en: Kurbonali is married and is a responsible father of three children. He is involved in buying and selling women's shoes at the local market. He started his business in 1996 when he sold his livestock and used this capital to acquire the goods for his business. He still successfully runs this business and has many loyal customers. Kurbonali wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $2000 for the purchase of women's shoes in order to expand his business and add to his revolving capital. He wants to thank you in advance for your support.

loan.use: to buy women's shoes

loan.name: Malkani's Group

texts.en:
Malkani is is the mother of 6 children. All of them are studying by going to a nearby school.
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husbands livestock business. With the loan, he will buy another buffalo that will help him get a larger quantity of milk for higher profits.
He is well experienced in his business and has been operating it for the past eight years. Malkani hopes that an investment will help her husband by providing a business asset for his business and also increasing his profits.
Malkani herself is a caring lady who carries out her responsibilities as a housewife very effectively. Besides her household work, she also sews clothes on a part-time basis to supplement the income of her family.
She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her third loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.

loan.use: To buy another buffalo.

loan.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Adelina believes that through patience and hard work her family will survive poverty. She is a hard-working mother who is engaged in a food-vending business to help her husband in financing the education of their five children. Because of the high costs of school fees and commodities, Adelina aims to improve her small business to satisfy her children's basic necessities.
She cooks and sells different kinds of snacks in their village, but her capital is not sufficient to acquire the needed ingredients to cook. Therefore, she is asking for additional capital of PHP 15,000 to buy flour, oil, fish balls, sugar, bananas and sweet potatoes to cook and sell in the village.
She mentioned that this loan will help a lot to make the business grow as she continues to work and strive harder. In the future, she hopes that she will improve the business and put up her own food stall near the school campus.

loan.use: to buy flour, oil, fish balls, sugar, bananas and sweet potatoes to cook and sell in their village.

loan.name: Normandina

texts.es:
La seora Normandina tiene 58 aos de edad, es viuda y madre de cinco hijos, reside en la Colonia Moncada Lobo en el municipio de Juticalpa y se dedica a la venta de ropa de segunda mano.
Doa Normandina inicio a vender ropa usada hace mas de 10 aos, trabaja conjunto a uno de sus hijos y lo hacen de forma ambulante. Todos los dias muy temprano por las maanas salen a las aldeas mas cercanas a realizar ventas y luego regresan a casa por las tardes. Normandina no sufre algn padecimiento grave, gracias a Dios es una persona sana, pero tiene una nieta con problemas en su vista y ya ha sido sometida a tres operaciones, actualmente la nia perdi totalmente su vista y no puede ver.
Doa Normandina solicita este prstamo para comprar tres fardos de ropa usada y as poder seguir teniendo una actividad econmica que le permita sostenerse y ayudar a su nietecita con los gastos mdicos de su enfermedad.
Su sueo es ver a su nieta recuperada y tener un local propio para ya no andar vendiendo de forma ambulante y exponindose a la delincuencia.
Doa Normandina tiene cuatro ciclos en FAMA y es una clienta muy puntual con los pagos.
texts.en:
Seora Normandina is 58 years old. She is a widow and mother of 5 children. She lives in the Colonia Moncada Lobo in the town of Juticalpa and she sells second hand clothes.
Doa Normandina started selling used clothes more than 10 years ago. She works with one of her children selling the clothes as street vendors. Every day very early in the morning they travel to the nearby villages to sell and then they come home in the afternoons. Normandina does not suffer from any serious medical condition; 'gracias a Dios' (thanks be to God) she is a healthy person but she has a granddaughter who has problems with her eyesight and has undergone 3 operations. The girl has now completely lost her eyesight and cannot see.
Doa Normandina is asking for the loan to purchase 3 bundles of used clothes so that she can continue to have an economic activity that gives her an upkeep and allows her to help her granddaughter with the medical expenses of her illness.
Her dream is to see her granddaughter recovered and to have her own premises so as to no longer be a street vendor exposed to crime.
Doa Normandina has 4 loan cycles with FAMA and is very punctual with her repayments.

loan.use: to buy bundles of used clothes

loan.name: Babylin

texts.en:
Babylin is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three school-aged children.
Babylin has a grocery shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for two years.
She requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell to support the needs of her family.
In the future, Babylin hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy can goods, snacks, coffee and sugar for her store.

loan.name: Dilshod

texts.en: Dilshod is an active and smart young man. He is involved in buying and selling livestock. He fattens up livestock over a set period of time and, once it gains weight, sells it at a profitable price. Dislhod wants to expand his business and maximize his profit. His brother helps him in this business, and they work well together. Dilshod wants to obtain a loan for the purchase of livestock. He hopes that creditors will support him.

loan.use: to buy livestock

loan.name: Manzooran's Group

texts.en:
Manzooran is a housewife and performs her household duties by staying at home. In her spare time, she also supports her husband financially by operating a sewing clothes business. She sews clothes for her neighboring clients to supplement the income of her family.
She doesnt have any children so she keeps herself busy in her household responsibilities and in her sewing business.
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband, who will buy another buffalo. This will help him get a larger quantity of milk and increase his sales and profits.
Manzooran is very confident that her husbands business will grow better after investing the loan into it and buying another buffalo. Her husband has been doing his business for the past eight years.
She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her third loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.

loan.use: To buy another buffalo.

loan.name: James

texts.en:
James says that hardships and difficulties are the stepping stones toward success.
He is a responsible father who raised his family in a village. Due to the hardships of life, he worked hard and tried harder to feed his family and send his two children to school.
The main source of their living is through farming. They plant rice and raise livestock for sale. The fruit of their patience and hard work helped their children to earn degrees and becomes professionals. They are proud to say that it is their big accomplishment in life.
Despite this, James wants to continue and improve the business to have a stable source of income. He wants to ask additional capital of PHP 7,000 to buy feed, vitamins and additional piglets to raise. He hopes that in the future, he can raise more pigs and make the business grow as he continues to work hard for it.

loan.use: to buy feed, vitamins and additional piglets to raise.

loan.name: Gerelmaa

texts.en:
Gerlemaa is 39 years old and lives with her husband and two children, ages 10 and 19, in a ger, a traditional Mongolian felt tent, which is located in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia, in an outer ger district without basic infrastructure. Her daughter is a student at the state university, and her son attends secondary school.
Gerelmaa supports her family by operating two clothing retail stalls at the largest outdoor market in Mongolia, with the help of her spouse. She started her business in 2000, specializing in the sale of women's clothes. Today her working capital is three million Mongolian tugriks (MNT).
She worked very hard the last few years, and she bought a small land plot and a car through the profit from her business. Consequently, she needs to increase her working capital and import more clothes to sell. So Gerelmaa is requesting a two-million-MNT loan to import more clothes from Ereen, a border city between Mongolia and China. With her business income, she is planning to pay her daughter's tuition fee.

loan.use: to purchase more clothes to sell in order to increase her income

loan.name: Zarina's Group

texts.en:
Zarinas husband is involved in a livestock business. He has some buffaloes at his home that he uses for getting milk that he sells to his community clients for profits.
Zarina is very active lady. She not only performs her household duties but also provides full support to her husband in his business. She is the mother of three children. Two of them are studying by attending a local school.
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husbands business. With the loan, he will buy another buffalo that will help him increase the production of milk and also his profits.
He has been operating his business for the past eight years and Zarina is hopeful that an investment will help him increase his profits and his business assets.
She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her third loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.

loan.use: To buy another buffalo.

loan.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 57 years old and has four adult children. They lived happily in a rural community, planting and harvesting rice and vegetables for sale. Due to the high cost school fees and commodities, some of their children did not pursue their studies, for they could not afford to finance their schooling.
Rosita and her husband helped each other to earn income and satisfy their basic necessities. Due to financial difficulty, Rosita engages in a duck-raising business to generate additional income.
At this time, Rosita aims to improve her duck-raising business but she doesn't have enough capital. Therefore, she is asking for additional capital of PHP 6,000 to buy feed and additional ducks to raise. She believes that through this loan, she will raise more ducks to bear eggs for sale.
In the future, she hopes that her business will grow and becomes a viable source of income.

loan.use: to buy feed and additional ducks to raise.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow and buy poultry

loan.name: Emanuel

texts.en:
Emanuel is a resident of Kitale in Western Kenya. He is 49 and married with five children, the youngest of whom are school-going age. He has been farming for 10 years and currently produces maize and milk for the local market. He also works as a carpenter.
Emanuel has requested a loan of 31,200 Kenyan shillings (KES) from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a dairy cow. He says with the experience he has in dairy farming, the loan will improve his farming income so he can cater for the education and needs of his children.
Emanuel laments hostile weather conditions and poor market prices for farm products as limitations in a farming business. He is glad, however, that Juhudi Kilimo provides farmers with loans.

loan.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loan.name: Sandra Margarita

texts.es:
Doa Sandra Margarita tiene 58 aos de edad, es casada y madre de cuatros hijos, reside en el Barrio La Hoya en el municipio de Juticalpa y se dedica a la venta de rosquillas y quesadillas.
Doa Sandra aprendi a elaborar las rosquillas y quesadillas desde hace mas de 30 aos y se form trabajando con una vecina que se dedicaba a esa actividad. Su producto es muy preferido por la poblacin Juticalpense y tambin por las personas que viven en el extranjero, ya que la mayor cantidad de su producto se le compran para enviarlo a familiares o amigos viven en los Estados Unidos. Trabaja en conjunto con su hijo menor, su jornada laboral inicia a las 4:00 am lo cual es muy sacrificado pero una vez que el producto sale del horno ella puede descansar y su hijo despacha a los clientes.
El prstamo que Doa Sandra esta solicitando lo necesita para comprar leche, maz, azcar, lea, huevos, entre otros productos para la elaboracin de las rosquillas y quesadillas.
